0.title: B'luru tutor beats 15-yr-old boy with iron pipe, injures his head; held
0.article_body: A tutor recently injured a Class 10 student's head after beating him with an iron pipe at a coaching centre near Bengaluru's Yelahanka. The tutor, Vijay Kumar, was arrested following a complaint by the 15-year-old boy's parents. Kumar said he wanted to threaten some boys over their "arrogant" reply by swaying an iron rod and never intended to beat them.

1.title: Sachin Tendulkar scored 1st of his 100 international hundreds as a 17-year-old
1.article_body: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar scored his maiden international hundred at the age of 17 years and 112 days on August 14, 1990, in a Test against England at Old Trafford. Playing in his ninth Test, Sachin scored 119*(189) in the second innings to help India draw the match. Sachin is the third youngest player to score a Test ton.

2.title: PSG set to offer Man Utd's Marcus Rashford long-term contract: Reports
2.article_body: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is set to be offered a long-term contract by Paris Saint-Germain, reports said. PSG manager Christopher Galtier is looking to pair Rashford with Kylian Mbappe in a two-man attack, reports added. Reports had earlier claimed there were "positive discussions" between the player and the Parisian football club regarding a transfer.

3.title: Tropical Storm Meari brings heavy rains in Japan
3.article_body: Tropical Storm Meari, with wind speeds of 72 km/h, brought heavy rains to Japan's Honshu island on Saturday as it moved northward towards the capital Tokyo. Over 72,000 people in the island's main city were asked to evacuate due to possible landslides. The storm is expected to move northward and then eastward into the Pacific Ocean by early Sunday.

4.title: Violence not a response to words: UN chief on Rushdie stabbing
4.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was "appalled" to learn about the attack on author Salman Rushdie, saying 'violence cannot be a response to words'. Rushdie was stabbed by a 24-year-old man in New York on Friday. "In no case is violence a response to words...written by others in their exercise of the freedoms of opinion and expression," Guterres said.

5.title: Himachal Pradesh records 423 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
5.article_body: Himachal Pradesh on Saturday reported 423 fresh cases of COVID-19, officials said, taking the state's active case count to 3,024. One death due to the infection was recorded in Sirmaur district. The state's death toll due to COVID-19 reached 4,163. On Friday, Himachal Pradesh had logged 443 cases of the infection and one fatality.

6.title: Army, NDRF teams reach MP's Dhar district after dam breached
6.article_body: The Army and National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel reached Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Saturday after an under-construction dam on the Karam river was breached. The government said water from the reservoir was being safely drained out to reduce pressure on its wall. People from 18 downstream villages have been preemptively shifted to safer areas.

7.title: Doctors conduct health check-up of jailed former WB minister
7.article_body: A team of eight doctors from state-run SSKM Hospital conducted a health check-up of jailed former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee at the Presidency Correctional Home in Kolkata on Saturday, an official said. The suspended Trinamool Congress leader had complained of back and leg pain. Chatterjee was prescribed exercises and a specific diet to control blood sugar, the official said.

8.title: Delhi reports 2,031 fresh COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths
8.article_body: Delhi logged 2,031 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday with a positivity rate of 12.34%, as per data shared by the health department. The city's single-day caseload remained above 2,000 for the 11th consecutive day. The national capital also recorded nine fatalities due to the infection. On Friday, Delhi had reported 10 deaths due to COVID-19, the highest in six months.

9.title: Number of Congress ministerial berth in Bihar finalised: AICC
9.article_body: Bihar in-charge of All India Congress Committee (AICC) Bhakta Charan Das on Saturday said that the number of ministerial berths Congress would get in Bihar's Mahagathbandhan government has been finalised. "The number would be [respectable and] as per our strength in the House. We've not yet finalised the names," he added. He said oath-taking is likely to happen on Tuesday.

10.title: UK minister switches sides to back Liz Truss in race for new PM
10.article_body: UK Cabinet Minister Robert Buckland who backed Rishi Sunak in the race to become Britain's next Prime Minister until recently, on Saturday switched sides to rival candidate Liz Truss' camp. Buckland said now he believes Truss is the "right person to take the country forward". He said Truss' plans are more suited to help the UK attain a "high-productivity economy".

11.title: Police arrest main accused behind dumping of meat at temple in UP
11.article_body: The main accused in the last month's meat dumping incident at a temple in Kannauj's Talgram town in Uttar Pradesh has been arrested, police said. The accused, Mansoor, is a butcher and was hired by a local, Chanchal Tripathi, to throw the meat as the latter aimed at getting the local SHO transferred. So far, 17 people have been arrested.

12.title: Video shows T'gana minister opening fire at Tiranga rally, says 'fired rubber bullet'
12.article_body: A video showing Telangana Prohibition and Excise Minister Srinivas Goud opening fire into the air from a gun at a Tiranga rally on Saturday has gone viral. The Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader allegedly opened fire from a loaded police gun, ANI reported. Dismissing the allegation, Goud said he had fired a rubber bullet. The incident reportedly happened in Mahabubnagar.

13.title: CCI approves merger of HDFC Bank and HDFC
13.article_body: The CCI has approved the proposal of merger of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) and HDFC Bank. The board of HDFC had approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank in April this year. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank.

14.title: The worst Olympic federation is better than AIFF: Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal
14.article_body: Talking about the current state of All India Football Federation (AIFF), which doesn't have an elected body and is run by an SC-appointed CoA, Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal said, "What's happening on the AIFF side is extremely tragic." "I can tell you for a fact that the worst Olympic federation is better than the AIFF," he added.

15.title: Acting is a tiring job, takes an emotional toll on you: Manoj Bajpayee
15.article_body: National Award-winning actor Manoj Bajpayee in an interview called acting a "tiring job". The actor, who has been shooting continuously for various projects in the past few months, added, "You've to play various characters who've their own emotions and I've always believed in giving my best, so it takes an emotional toll which takes...long time to come out of it."

16.title: What is true is true: Johar on revealing Sara and Kartik's relationship
16.article_body: Karan Johar has responded after being accused of sharing personal details about celebrities' relationships on his talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. Johar, who confirmed Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan's relationship in one of the episodes, said, "Everyone knows about these relationships. I'm not making anything up." "What's true is true and I suppose everyone's okay with it," he added.

17.title: Germany urges businesses to curb heating to reduce gas consumption
17.article_body: Germany's Economy Minister on Saturday said that German businesses and public institutions should heat their offices no higher than 19 degrees Celsius this winter to help reduce consumption of natural gas. Germany aims to reduce its dependence on gas from Russia in response to the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Germany has also imposed sanctions on Russia due to the invasion.

18.title: 24-hour rail strike to hit holidayers and football fans in UK
18.article_body: Thousands of UK train drivers went on a 24-hour strike on Saturday, protesting against proposed job cuts and demanding better pay and working conditions. Many British rail companies are considering employment cuts as the country experienced a 40-year-high rate of inflation this year. The strike is set to disturb the plans of holidayers and football fans going to stadiums.

19.title: VLC Media Player website & download link blocked in India
19.article_body: The website of VLC Media Player, one of the most popular media players across multiple platforms, has been blocked by the government in India. Users are unable to download the program's exe file for installation from the website videolan.org. However, the media player's Android app is still available on Google Play Store and already-installed players are also working, reports said.

20.title: India didn't let China intrude into its territory: Rajnath Singh
20.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that India did not let Chinese forces trespass on its territory. "Many incidents happened in this matter, which only we two-three people know," Rajnath stated. "I cannot divulge those details," he added. The Defence Minister further urged political parties not to politicise issues related to national security.

21.title: Saumya Tandon urges fans to donate for Deepesh Bhan's family to repay ₹50 lakh home loan
21.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actress Saumya Tandon launched an initiative to help late actor Deepesh Bhan's family. She requested people to donate and help Deepesh's family repay a home loan worth ₹50 lakh. "He...often used to talk about his home...Now, we can repay him by giving back his house to his son," said Saumya.

22.title: When I was low, I met PM Modi and he gave me motivation: CWG 2022 gold medallist Vinesh
22.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who bagged gold at CWG 2022, said that she almost gave up wrestling as she couldn't win a medal in two successive Olympics. "When I was low, I met Modi ji (PM Narendra Modi) and he gave me motivation. He said 'We trust you and you can do it'. That reignited the spark in me," she stated.

23.title: Ex-Chelsea footballer Willian leaves Corinthians after death threats
23.article_body: Former Arsenal and Chelsea player Willian said he has terminated his contract and left Sao Paulo-based club Corinthians after receiving death threats. "I did not come to Brazil to get threatened...If sometimes I was not doing well...my family received threats and curses," said the Brazilian. On Friday, Willian expressed his wish to return to Europe again.

24.title: Afraid of losing social prestige during ED investigation: Kolkata Mayor
24.article_body: Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) Mayor Firhad Hakim on Saturday said he's not afraid of going to jail, but afraid of losing social prestige during the investigation process of Enforcement Directorate (ED). "Several saints of Bengal have been to jail. But, everyone is scared of loss of...social prestige and while ED starts their investigation, media starts their own trial," Hakim said.

25.title: Firefighters halt spread of "monster" wildfire in France's Gironde
25.article_body: Firefighters have managed to halt the spread of a "monster" blaze that has ravaged forests in France's Gironde region since Tuesday, according to French authorities. Notably, storms are expected to sweep through France on Saturday night, bringing down temperatures and prompting severe weather warnings. Successive heatwaves have sparked wildfires across Europe this summer.

26.title: Carlo Ancelotti to retire after current Real Madrid stint
26.article_body: Record four-time UEFA Champions League-winning head coach Carlo Ancelotti has said that he will retire after his current stint with Real Madrid. "Real Madrid means top level, so it makes sense to consider this club as the end of my career," said the 63-year-old. Ancelotti's current contract with the club runs until June 2024.

27.title: Will hold classes for those doubting RSS' contribution in independence: Surya
27.article_body: BJYM President Tejasvi Surya said that the BJP's youth wing will hold history classes for those who are questioning RSS' contribution to India's freedom struggle. "It is unfortunate that...a typical history was taught which is only about appreciating a single-family. Whereas the contribution of freedom fighters including...Veer Savarkar...and others is purposely neglected," Surya said.

28.title: Pakistan set to attend counter-terror exercises in India: Report
28.article_body: Pakistan will attend counter-terrorism drills which will be hosted by India in October this year, Press Trust of India reported on Saturday quoting Pakistani media. The drills will be held under the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation. The exercise will see participation from China, Russia, Iran, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan besides India.

29.title: 'Wedding kits' with condoms, contraceptive pills to be given to newly married couples in Odisha
29.article_body: Odisha government has decided to provide 'wedding kits' to newly married couples from September to raise awareness about family planning. The kits will contain contraceptive pills, condoms and a booklet on methods and benefits of family planning among other items. "This is...part of the National Health Mission's 'Nai Pahal Scheme'," Director of Family Planning Bijay Panigrahy said.

30.title: A lot of older players will get offers from various T20 leagues: Chappell
30.article_body: Former cricketer Ian Chappell said that many "older players will get offers" from various T20 leagues and it will pose a challenge to several cricket boards. "If you've got a decent IPL contract and the choice is between Australia and your IPL franchise's UAE team, well are you going to put your IPL contract at risk?" Chappell asked.

31.title: WHO gives new names to monkeypox variants 'to avoid causing offence'
31.article_body: WHO has announced new names for variants of the monkeypox virus, in order to "avoid causing offence to any cultural, social, national, regional, professional or ethnic groups". The former Congo Basin (Central African) clade has been renamed Clade one (I). The former West African clade will be Clade two (II) and its subclades will be Clade IIa and Clade IIb.

32.title: JK Rowling receives death threat after tweet on Salman Rushdie, shares screenshot
32.article_body: Author JK Rowling received a potential death threat following her reaction tweet to attack on Salman Rushdie in New York. "Feeling very sick right now...Let him be ok," Rowling had written after attack on Rushdie. She shared a screenshot of a user saying, "Don't worry you're next," in response to her tweet. She also shared a picture of the user.

33.title: Test cricket won't die in my lifetime but who'll be playing it: Ian Chappell
33.article_body: Former Australian skipper Ian Chappell has commented on the future of five-day cricket. "Test cricket won't die in my lifetime. But who'll be playing it?" Chappell asked. The 78-year-old added, "If you haven't got your best players, is Test cricket worth watching? The answer is probably no. Test cricket is a good game, but it's got to be well played."

34.title: High salinity found in German-Polish river after mass fish die-off
34.article_body: High levels of salinity were detected in Oder River, which runs through Germany and Poland, after a mass dying off of fish, Poland's Environment Minister Anna Moskwa said on Saturday.  Comprehensive toxicology studies are still underway in Poland, she added. Earlier, Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that huge amounts of chemical waste were probably dumped in the river.

35.title: 5 BJP workers arrested for throwing slippers at TN Minister's car
35.article_body: Five BJP workers have been arrested for allegedly throwing slippers at Tamil Nadu Finance Minister Palanivel Thiaga Rajan's car when he was returning from Madurai Airport. The accused have been arrested under Sections 506, 341 and 34 of the IPC. The minister was returning after paying his respects to one of the soldiers killed in the J&K Rajouri district attack.

36.title: I was once dragged into a jungle by a man in Delhi: Ratan Raajputh
36.article_body: TV actress Ratan Raajputh recalled an incident from her early days in Delhi and revealed that her phone was snatched while she was returning home from Mandi House. She added she chased the person and he brought her far away into a dense forest. "Suddenly a boy appeared...[and] he...dragged me into...forest," Ratan said, adding she got help from a student.

37.title: 4 minors accused of raping married woman in Assam's Morigaon, 1 held
37.article_body: Police on Saturday said that a 16-year-old boy was arrested in Assam's Morigaon district for allegedly raping a married woman. Three other minor boys were also allegedly involved in the crime and are currently absconding, a police official said. The victim approached the police and filed a complaint when her husband refused to "accept her", the official added.

38.title: 4 dead, 9 injured in flash flood in southwest China
38.article_body: A flash flood in southwest China left four people dead and nine others injured on Saturday, local authorities informed. In a video published by Chinese media, tourists playing in a river could be seen running for safety following a rapid rise in the river's water level. The video also showed a woman being swept away by the current.

39.title: Ayodhya Ram Temple construction to be over by December 2023: Trust
39.article_body: The Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra has said the construction of the Ayodhya Ram Temple would be completed by December 2023. "The temple will be ready for 'darshan' by devotees in December 2023," said the Trust's General Secretary Champat Rai. He also claimed that iron was not being used in the construction and the design would amaze people.

40.title: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari rewards CWG medallist Divya Kakran with ₹5 lakh
40.article_body: Northeast Delhi BJP MP Manoj Tiwari on Friday rewarded CWG 2022 medallist wrestler Divya Kakran with ₹5 lakh. This comes after Divya claimed she had not received help from the Delhi government despite living in the city for 20 years. Divya had requested the AAP government to honour her the way they honour players from Delhi who represent other states.

41.title: Shakib Al Hasan named Bangladesh captain for Asia Cup, T20 World Cup
41.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has appointed Shakib Al Hasan as the captain for the upcoming Asia Cup and T20 World Cup. Before being named captain, Shakib was reportedly told by the cricket board to choose between playing for Bangladesh or keep endorsing "betting company" Betwinner News. The Bangladesh Test captain then ended his contract with the company.

42.title: Gippy praises Aamir's 'Laal...' look, says 'Punjabis don't like fake beards'
42.article_body: Actor-singer Gippy Grewal in an interview praised Aamir Khan's look in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', saying that the actor looks "totally like a Sardaar" in the film. Aamir grew a beard and gained weight for his role in the Advait Chandan directorial. Gippy further said, "As a Punjabi, when we see a 'Punjabi' person with fake beard, we don't like it."

43.title: Used inverted commas: Kerala MLA Jaleel on ‘Azad Kashmir’ remark
43.article_body: CPI(M)-backed Kerala MLA KT Jaleel said he only had "sympathy" for those who didn't understand his use of the double inverted commas in calling Pakistan-occupied Kashmir 'Azad Kashmir'. In his response, however, the legislator did not talk about his use of the words "India-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir". The BJP had called for the MLA to be booked for sedition.

44.title: Woman saves son from cobra in K'taka seconds before it was about to bite him, video viral
44.article_body: A video of a Karnataka woman rescuing her child from a cobra seconds before it was about to bite him has gone viral. The video is from Mandya district, and shows the child unknowingly stepping very close to the cobra. The mother acts immediately, grabs the child, holds him up on her shoulder and runs to safety.

45.title: Why is NASA preparing to crash a spacecraft into an asteroid next month?
45.article_body: NASA has said that it will intentionally crash its Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) spacecraft into an asteroid on September 26, 2022. This will be done to "demonstrate and test" DART's capability to deflect asteroids, NASA said. It could be used if, in the future, a hazardous asteroid on a collision course with Earth was ever found, it added.

46.title: PM's mother distributes national flags to kids in Guj ahead of I-Day
46.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben Modi distributed national flags to children in Gujarat as the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign began on Saturday. A video showed the PM's mother and some children waving the Tricolour at a residence. Heeraben Modi, aged 100, also hoisted the Tricolour ahead of Independence Day. India will celebrate 75 years of independence on August 15.

47.title: Over 2,100 cattle die in Punjab due to lumpy skin disease
47.article_body: The Punjab Animal Husbandry Department has said that more than 2,100 cattle have died while over 60,000 were affected by lumpy skin disease in the state. The disease infects cows and buffaloes leading to the formation of lumps on the animal's skin. Other than Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Gujarat and Andaman and Nicobar Islands have been affected by the disease.

48.title: Patiala Central Jail inmate escapes after finding security lapse
48.article_body: A Patiala Central Jail inmate escaped from the prison by scaling a wall after finding no security there at 7:15 am. The costly live electricity wire fencing the jail had installed was not working at the time. Officials came to know of the escape five hours later when they tried to locate him for his court appearance.

49.title: 15 migrants found dead in desert on border with Sudan: Libya
49.article_body: At least 15 migrants were found dead in the desert on the borders with Sudan, Libyan authorities said on Saturday. The migrants were on their way from Sudan to Libya when their vehicle broke down due to lack of fuel, they added. The migrants likely attempted to reach Libya in an effort to board trafficking boats to Europe.

50.title: The Academy calls 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a 'faithful Indian adaptation'
50.article_body: The Academy on Saturday called Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a 'faithful' adaptation of Tom Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "Robert Zemeckis and Eric Roth's sweeping story of a man who changes the world with kindness receives a faithful Indian adaptation," read The Academy's tweet. It further added that 'Forrest Gump' was nominated for 13 Oscars including six wins.

51.title: Time to strike last nail in terrorism's coffin has come: J&K LG
51.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said that "the right time" to "strike the last nail in the coffin of terrorism" in the Union Territory has come. He also said some people were trying to create disturbances at the "behest of the neighbouring country". Sinha added that the younger generations should not face the same hardships as their forefathers.

52.title: Bihar Congress to meet Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday
52.article_body: Bihar Congress in-charge Bhakta Charan Das said the party will hold a meeting with state CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday. The leader said he has already spoken to party chief Sonia Gandhi and leader Rahul Gandhi about the political developments in the state. The new Bihar alliance will undergo a floor test on August 24.

53.title: Punjab Guv clears 'One MLA-One Pension' bill; CM says 'will save tax'
53.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said that the 'One MLA-One Pension' bill has been cleared by Governor Banwarilal Purohit. "This will save a lot of tax for the public," Mann tweeted. Till now, MLAs received separate payouts for each term they had served. The Governor's assent comes about three months after the state Cabinet cleared the bill.

54.title: Juvenile rape, murder convict released by SC after 19-year term
54.article_body: The Supreme Court released a man who had served a 19-year term for the rape and murder of a minor girl. The court said it was found that the man was a minor while committing the crime and a juvenile cannot be put behind bars for more than three years. He was originally awarded a death sentence in the case.

55.title: 24-yr-old man who stabbed Salman Rushdie charged with attempted murder & assault
55.article_body: Hadi Matar, a 24-year-old New Jersey man who stabbed author Salman Rushdie in New York on Friday, has been charged with attempted murder in the second degree, the Chautauqua County district attorney's office said on Saturday. He has also been charged with assault in the second degree. "He was arraigned on these charges...and remanded without bail," the statement added.

56.title: Russian forces carry out strikes on residential areas across Ukraine
56.article_body: Russia's military carried out strikes on residential areas across Ukraine overnight. A Russian spokesman claimed that a US-supplied multiple rocket launcher was destroyed in strikes near Kramatorsk city. The Ukrainian Governor of Luhansk province, which is part of the fight over Donbas region and was overrun by Russian forces in July, claimed that Ukraine's forces still held a small area.

57.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75 found in majority of samples from Delhi
57.article_body: Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75 has been detected in more than half of the samples, analysed as part of a study, from COVID-19 patients in Delhi, LNJP Hospital's MD Dr Suresh Kumar said on Saturday. BA.2.75 is spreading faster than other variants and "escaping immunity", Dr Kumar said. The Omicron sub-variant was first detected in India in June.

58.title: Army chief General Manoj Pande visits Chennai Military Station
58.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande on Saturday visited the Chennai Military Station, a defence release said. General Pande "highlighted the transformative and forward-looking Agnipath scheme", as per the PIB release. According to the release, the Indian Army chief also outlined the changing dynamics of modern warfare. He also highlighted the need for enhancing defence production capabilities.

59.title: Air India flight seats changed despite check-in, says Jet Airways CEO; airline responds
59.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said that recently while boarding an Air India flight with his son, his seats were changed at the gate despite a web check-in. He said the staff couldn't give him a reason for moving him, adding that another family with kids faced the same issue. Air India said it's looking into the issue's "root cause".

60.title: What PM Modi is going to promise in 15th Aug speech this year: Swamy
60.article_body: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy has asked that "what PM Narendra Modi is going to promise" in his Independence Day speech this year. "In his Independence Day speech in 2017, PM Modi made the following promises to be achieved by 15th August of 2022...Two crore new jobs every year...housing for all...doubling farmers' income...bullet train...Has it happened?" Swamy asked.

61.title: 9 killed, 18 injured in road accident in Egypt's Minya province
61.article_body: A road accident involving an overturned microbus in Egypt's Minya province on Friday claimed the lives of at least nine people and left 18 others injured, authorities informed. The passenger vehicle crashed when it overturned on a highway following a tire blowout, a statement by authorities said. The microbus was ferrying people from Sohag province to Cairo, the statement added.

62.title: CRPF personnel injured in grenade attack in Srinagar: Police
62.article_body: Police said that a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel was injured when terrorists hurled a grenade at security forces in Srinagar's Eidgah locality on Saturday. The police said the explosion caused minor splinter injuries to one CRPF personnel. A cordon and search operation has been launched to arrest the culprits, they added.

63.title: CRPF holds 'Har Ghar Tiranga' walkathon rally in J&K's Budgam
63.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) on Friday organised a walkathon rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam area, officials said. The rally was conducted as a part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "We've gathered...to remember and salute the brave hearts who laid down their lives for the nation," 181 Battalion Commandant Om Hari said.

64.title: Land worth ₹6 cr seized in case against Ex-MLA Mukhtar Ansari in UP
64.article_body: Police said that Ghazipur district administration in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday seized two plots of land valued at ₹6.30 crore that were purchased using illegal earnings of jailed former MLA and gangster Mukhtar Ansari. Two plots in Rajdepur and Fatehullahpur were registered in the name of Ansari's wife, police said. The properties were seized under Section 14(1) of Gangsters Act.

65.title: 100 Sikhs & Hindus in Afghanistan waiting to come to India: Sikh leader
65.article_body: Around 100 Afghan Sikhs and Hindus in Afghanistan want to come to India but are unable to as some of their family members are yet to receive their e-visas, an Afghan Sikh leader said. About 28 members of the group are yet to receive their visas. The situation is volatile in Afghanistan, according to the leader.

66.title: PV Sindhu ruled out of Badminton World Championships
66.article_body: PV Sindhu, who bagged a gold medal at CWG 2022, has been ruled out of the upcoming Badminton World Championships due to an ankle injury. As per reports, Sindhu sustained the injury during the quarterfinals of the CWG 2022. Sindhu has won a gold medal, two silver medals and two bronze medals in the history of World Championships.

67.title: Ex-Pak captain Sarfaraz Ahmed's bio added to Class 4 syllabus in Sindh, he shares pics
67.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed's biography has been added to Class 4 syllabus in Pakistan's Sindh. The cricketer took to Twitter to share pictures and wrote, "Thank you! This is a big honour for me. As role models we endeavour to inspire children. I would always be there to play my part in these efforts."

68.title: Would love to see Karthik bat for more overs: Maninder Singh
68.article_body: Former India spinner Maninder Singh has said that he would "love" to see Dinesh Karthik bat for "more" overs for the Indian team. "I would love...but if this is what Rahul Dravid, his captain and the selectors have decided, I think let's back them," Maninder said. He added, "Every coach...[and] every captain comes with a different plan."

69.title: US says India shipped fuel made from Russian crude to America: RBI Deputy Governor
69.article_body: RBI Deputy Governor Michael Patra said India was informed by the US Treasury Department about fuel made from Russian crude being shipped to New York on an Indian ship, in violation of US sanctions on Russia. The ship allegedly picked crude from a Russian tanker mid-sea, brought it to Gujarat for refining and took it to the US, Patra revealed.

70.title: He showed KRK his place: Vindu recalls Raju Srivastava's Bigg Boss journey
70.article_body: Actor Vindu Dara Singh, recalling his 'Bigg Boss 3' days, said that his journey became "much easier" because of co-contestant and comedian Raju Srivastava. He revealed that Raju had a huge fight with Kamaal R Khan (KRK) on the show. "He got angry and really showed KRK his place...he really gave KRK a piece of his mind," said Vindu.

71.title: Akshay Kumar to return as Jagdish Mishra in 'Jolly LLB 3': Report
71.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar will reportedly reprise his role as Jagdish Mishra in 'Jolly LLB 3'. According to a report, the upcoming project will be directed by Subhash Kapoor, who also helmed the first two parts of the franchise. "The third part will be bigger and better than the earlier two," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

72.title: Assam man's corpse buried as locals refuse cremation over inter-caste marriage
72.article_body: A man's body was recently buried by his family in Assam's Darrang after fellow villagers refused to touch his body and help with the cremation as he had married outside his caste, district administration officials said. The officials exhumed the body on Friday. They said Atul Sarma, a Brahmin, had married a woman from Koch community around 27 years ago.

73.title: Live monkey, snakes recovered from passenger at Chennai airport; pics surface
73.article_body: A passenger illegally carrying live animals from Bangkok was intercepted at Chennai airport by Customs officers on Thursday. On examination of checked-in baggage, 1 De Brazza's monkey, 15 kingsnakes, 5 ball pythons and 2 aldabra tortoises were recovered. Since the live animals were imported illegally, they were deported back to the country of origin.

74.title: Punjab govt issues COVID-19 advisory, says 'wear appropriate masks'
74.article_body: Punjab government's Department of Home Affairs issued a COVID-19 advisory on Saturday and said that COVID-19 positive cases and hospitalisation are showing an upward trend. It instructed people to wear appropriate masks in all educational institutions, government and private offices, malls, public places and the like. It also asked people to follow social distancing and respiratory etiquettes.

75.title: Anshu Jain, former co-CEO of Deutsche Bank, passes away at 59 due to duodenal cancer
75.article_body: Former co-CEO of Deutsche Bank Anshu Jain passed away aged 59 after battling duodenal cancer for five years. He was serving as the president of Cantor Fitzgerald. He had served as co-CEO of Deutsche Bank between 2012 and 2015. Before joining Deutsche Bank in 1995, Jain worked at Merrill Lynch. Jain was born in Jaipur.

76.title: CM Bommai is here to stay: BJP on rumours about replacing him
76.article_body: Amid speculations about the replacement of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, BJP National General Secretary in charge of Karnataka Arun Singh on Saturday said Bommai "is here to stay". "Our leadership has placed complete confidence in him," Singh said. "I can say with 100% confidence that the next assembly election will be fought under Basavaraj Bommai," Singh added.

77.title: 2 teenage boys, aged 14 & 15, drown in Swan river in Himachal's Una
77.article_body: Two teenagers drowned in Swan river in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Saturday, the State Disaster Management Authority said. The incident took place when the victims, 14-year-old Sahil and 15-year-old Jatin, from Lower Bhadsali village accidentally drowned while taking bath in Swan river near Lower Batheda of Haroli sub-division, they added.

78.title: HP Assembly passes bill banning forced conversions, extends jail term to 10 yrs
78.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Assembly passed a bill on Saturday forbidding forced mass conversions. The bill also extends the maximum punishment to 10 years imprisonment in its 2019 law against any change of religion through force or allurement. The Himachal Pradesh Freedom of Religion (Amendment) Bill, 2022, was passed unanimously with a voice vote. The state government introduced the bill on Friday.

79.title: World record for largest human image of a waving national flag created in India
79.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, the Guinness World Record for 'Largest Human Image of a Waving National Flag' was created by Chandigarh University and the NID Foundation, a non-governmental organisation, on Saturday. The record was accomplished with the participation of 5,885 people. "One such record was set in the UAE, years ago. Today, that record has been broken," an official stated.

80.title: K'taka policeman suspended for assaulting villager, inquiry ordered
80.article_body: A police sub-inspector (PSI), Manikanta, was suspended from duty and a departmental inquiry was ordered after a video surfaced of him assaulting a villager in Karnataka's Ballari district, the police said. According to the police, the victim has been identified as Gangadhar, a villager in the same district. According to villagers, the policeman and Gangadhar had an old personal rivalry.

81.title: 27% of Ukraine will need to be cleared of mines & explosives: Govt
81.article_body: Ukraine's Ecology Ministry estimates that about 27% of the country's territory will need to be cleared of mines and explosives. Making that area safe could take a decade, the government said. Notably, the US has approved $89 million worth of assistance to help Ukraine equip and train 100 teams to clear landmines and unexploded ordnance for a year.

82.title: Minor girl kills herself at lover's residence in UP
82.article_body: A minor girl allegedly died by suicide at the residence of her lover in Bulandshahr, Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, her lover, who lived in the neighbourhood, also allegedly tried to kill himself by consuming poison and is admitted to a local hospital, police said. The girl was found hanging at the boy's residence on Saturday morning, police added.

83.title: 38-yr-old farmer killed by unidentified miscreants in UP's Sambhal
83.article_body: A 38-year-old farmer, Vijay Kumar, was killed by unidentified miscreants while he was working in his farm in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal, police said on Saturday. The farmer was killed using a sharp-edged weapon, Additional Superintendent of Police Aalok Jaiswal said. Prima facie, the incident appears to be a result of personal enmity, Jaiswal added.

84.title: BJP does what it says; we get this inspiration from sons of soil: Rajnath
84.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh has said that "the BJP does what it says". "We get this inspiration from sons of the soil like [Rajput general] Veer Durgadas Rathore," Rajnath said at an event in Jodhpur. He added, "We need to learn from Rathore at a time when some powers are conspiring to widen the rift between Hindus and Muslims."

85.title: Delhi HC criticises DDA for woman's 30-year-long wait to get Rohini plot
85.article_body: The Delhi High Court has criticised Delhi Development Authority (DDA) for failing to give a plot in Rohini to an octogenarian woman, who had an allotment letter since 1991. The court upheld a single-bench decision directing the DDA to give a 60 sq metre plot to the woman within four weeks. The court called the DDA "lackadaisical and abhorrently unprofessional".

86.title: 24 cadaver donations made in Pune this year
86.article_body: As many as 24 cadaver donations have been done in Pune city this year. "So far this year, Pune has seen the maximum organ donations across Maharashtra," said Arti Gokhale, Central Coordinator of the Zonal Transplant Coordination Committee. In Maharashtra this year, Mumbai has carried out 22 organ transplants, followed by Nagpur at five and Aurangabad at one.

87.title: Cut-off marks in 2nd merit list drop in FYJC admissions in Pune
87.article_body: The second merit list of first-year junior college (FYJC) admissions in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions has seen a drop in cut-off marks for the top 10 colleges. Of the 59,517 available seats in the second round, 41,115 applications were received and 17,062 students were allotted a college. In this round, 5,586 students got the college of their first choice.

88.title: Class 12 student stabbed to death in a clash between students in Bengaluru
88.article_body: A clash between two college groups led to the death of a class 12 student near a college located in the HBR layout area of Bengaluru. The deceased, Arbaaz Mohammad (18), had a verbal spat with one of his seniors during the cultural fest a few days before the latter along with his associates stabbed Arbaaz to death, police said.

89.title: DGCA issues guidelines to prevent bird strikes at airports
89.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Saturday issued guidelines to check incidents of collision of planes with birds and other animals at airports across India. It stated that all airport operators must review their wildlife hazard management programme and ensure its strict implementation. Airports must have a procedure to monitor and record wildlife movement data, the regulator added.

90.title: Sri Lanka allows entry to Chinese 'spy' ship despite India's concerns: Report
90.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday granted docking permission to a Chinese surveillance ship despite India's concerns over it being used to 'spy' on its military installations, a report said, quoting officials. Sri Lanka's harbour master said he has received diplomatic clearance to allow Yuan Wang 5 to dock at Hambantota port from August 16 to 22, the report added.

91.title: 2 more ships leave Ukraine under grain export deal: Turkey
91.article_body: Two more ships carrying agricultural products departed from Ukraine's Black Sea ports on Saturday, Turkey's Defence Ministry said. This takes the number of cargo ships to leave Ukraine through the Black Sea under the grain export deal signed in July to 16. Turkey's Defence Ministry also said that another ship would leave Turkey for Ukraine on Saturday to buy grains.

92.title: Shanghai extends weekly COVID-19 testing requirement till Sept end
92.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai on Saturday announced that the measure under which residents need to undergo weekly COVID-19 testing has been extended till the end of September. Individuals without a record of a nucleic acid test in the past seven days would be assigned a yellow code on Shanghai's health code system. A yellow code limits access to public places.

93.title: Golden joint of world's highest railway bridge in J&K completed, govt shares pics
93.article_body: Work on the golden joint of the world's highest railway bridge on the Chenab river has been completed, Railways said on Saturday. It shared pictures and videos from the ceremony to mark golden joint completion (which indicates bridge is around 98% complete) in J&K. Workers were seen hosting the national flag, burning firecrackers and chanting 'Vande Mataram' at the ceremony.

94.title: Canadian city declares state of emergency over water scarcity
94.article_body: Iqaluit, a Canadian city in the Arctic region, on Friday declared a state of emergency after the local Apex River's water levels hit a four-decade low due to scarce rainfall this year. The city has warned that the water in its reservoir could prove to be inadequate to sustain its population of about 7,800 during the freeze-up of winter months.

95.title: Vijay Sethupathi to play a negative role in Shah Rukh Khan's 'Jawan'
95.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming 'Jawan' will feature Vijay Sethupathi in a negative role. The film, being directed by Atlee Kumar, will also feature Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra. 'Jawan' is scheduled to release in theatres on June 2, 2023. Vijay is also working on 'Merry Christmas', a Sriram Raghavan directorial also starring Katrina Kaif and Sanjay Kapoor.

96.title: Man arrested for hoisting Pakistan's national flag in UP
96.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly hoisting the national flag of Pakistan at his residence in Vedupar Mustaquil village in Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh. According to the police, the flag was removed as soon as the officials were informed. Notably, the arrested accused is identified as Salman (21) while two others, including a woman, have been booked, police said.

97.title: Rajasthan Royals owner slapped me 3-4 times in a bar after I got out for a duck: Taylor
97.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor, in his autobiography, revealed one of the Rajasthan Royals' owners slapped him three-four times in a bar after he got out for a duck against Punjab Kings in 2011. "[The owner] said, 'Ross...we didn't pay you a million dollars to get a duck'...I couldn't imagine it happening in many professional sporting environments," Taylor wrote.

98.title: Guj ex-Dy CM suffers leg fracture as cow hits him at Tiranga Yatra, video surfaces
98.article_body: Former Gujarat Deputy Chief Minister Nitin Patel suffered a minor fracture in his leg after being attacked by a stray cow in Kadi during a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Saturday. Patel said the cow "suddenly came running" and attacked him near a vegetable market. A video showed Patel and other people falling to the ground after the cow rushed past them.

99.title: Taliban fighters fire in air to disperse women protesters in Kabul
99.article_body: Taliban fighters in Kabul fired into the air to disperse a group of women protesting in front of the Education Ministry building. Some of the women protesters who took refuge in nearby shops were chased and beaten by Taliban fighters with their rifle butts. Notably, this comes days ahead of the first anniversary of Taliban's return to power in Afghanistan.

100.title: My role was first offered to Govinda: Anil on 23 yrs of 'Taal'
100.article_body: Anil Kapoor took to Instagram to share a post marking 23 years of his film 'Taal'. He recalled how he was "destined" to be a part of 'Taal' as the role that he played in the film was first offered to Govinda. Anil added it was his performance in 'Taal' that got him a role in Danny Boyle's 'Slumdog Millionaire'.

101.title: Nick Kyrgios' 9-match winning streak ends in Canadian Masters QF
101.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios' nine-match winning streak came to an end on Friday after the 27-year-old lost his quarter-final match to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz at the Canadian Masters in Montreal. However, when being asked about the streak getting ended, Kyrgios quipped, "I honestly don't care...Have been away from my mum...[and] dad...They're not very well at the moment."

102.title: Man digs tunnel to rob bank in Italy, rescued as tunnel collapses
102.article_body: A man who allegedly dug a tunnel as part of a planned bank heist in Italy was rescued by police after the tunnel collapsed. The man is suspected to be part of a four-member gang that planned to carry out the robbery in Rome this weekend. The other three suspects reportedly fled the six-metre tunnel before it collapsed.

103.title: Man killed on busy road in Delhi after argument over urinating on wall, says police
103.article_body: A 25-year-old hotel management graduate was stabbed to death by four men in Delhi's Malviya Nagar. He was attacked following an altercation that started over him urinating on a wall, slapping one of the men and abusing his mother who objected to his urination, police said. The men were arrested after they were identified with the help of CCTV footage.

104.title: MS Dhoni changes his Instagram DP to Tricolour with caption in 3 languages
104.article_body: Former India captain MS Dhoni changed his Instagram display picture (DP) to a Tricolour ahead of India's 76th Independence Day. The picture contained a caption in three languages: Sanskrit, Hindi and English. "I am blessed to be a Bharatiya," it read in English. PM Narendra Modi had urged citizens to change their profile pictures on social media to National Flag.

105.title: Police beef up security at Red Fort ahead of PM's I-Day address
105.article_body: Security at Delhi's Red Fort has been beefed up ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's address to the nation on Independence Day from the Mughal-era monument. Apart from the 10,000 police personnel who will be deployed around the monument on Monday, anti-drone systems and facial recognition systems are also being installed. Around 7,000 attendees are expected at the event.

106.title: Portion of Thane residential building collapses, no one hurt
106.article_body: A portion of a five-storey residential building in Thane's Daighar area has collapsed, officials said on Saturday. No one was hurt in the incident which occurred on Friday night. Residents and the shops on the ground floor have been evacuated and the building has been marked for being pulled down, chief of the Regional Disaster Management Cell Avinash Sawant said.

107.title: T20 cricket can be very fickle in its nature: Williamson
107.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson has said that "T20 cricket can be very fickle in its nature". "We are just trying to improve and bring guys into the side and give them clear roles...Just trying to keep things nice and simple," Williamson said. New Zealand took an unassailable lead of 2-0 in the series against the West Indies on Friday.

108.title: 6 arrested from Delhi's outer district for fuel theft from tankers
108.article_body: Six men were arrested from Delhi's outer district area on Friday after they were allegedly caught siphoning fuel from tankers. Police said they received information that one Amarjeet would siphon fuel from tankers at Swarn Park and sell the stolen fuel. Owner of one of the tankers from which fuel was allegedly being siphoned gave a complaint to the police.

109.title: Brazil reports record deforestation in Amazon from Jan-July in 2022
109.article_body: Deforestation in Brazil's Amazon rainforest reached a record high for the first seven months of the year, according to preliminary government data. Government satellite data showed 5,474 square kilometres were cleared in the region from January to July, up 7.3% from the same period of last year. Notably, 1,487 square kilometres were cleared in July alone.

110.title: 21,000 fish killed due to ‘catastrophic failure’ at California university
110.article_body: A "catastrophic failure" has resulted in the loss of about 21,000 fish at a university research facility in California. "The loss appears to be due to chlorine exposure, to which fish are...sensitive," a statement read. The University of California, Davis, said it has initiated an independent external review to determine where its systems failed and potential risks at similar facilities.

111.title: Women need to sleep with someone for K'taka govt job, says Cong MLA; BJP responds
111.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge on Friday stated that "men have to bribe while young women have to sleep with someone to get a government job" in BJP-ruled Karnataka. He demanded an investigation into recruitment scams. BJP leader and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "Whatever he said was happening during Congress rule- at the Centre and in state."

112.title: 3 men pose as policemen to rob gold worth ₹22 lakh in Mumbai, arrested
112.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested three men for allegedly robbing gold worth ₹22 lakh from a man who had recently returned from Dubai. According to the police, the men posed as police officials and stopped the victim's auto-rickshaw. On the pretext of checking the vehicle, they robbed the gold and escaped on a bike. Another accused is currently absconding, police added.

113.title: Protests were aimed at overthrowing govt: Sierra Leone's Prez
113.article_body: Sierra Leone's President Julius Maada Bio on Friday said that this week's anti-government protests were an attempt to overthrow the government. The protests led to the deaths of six police officers and at least 21 civilians. However, several residents have said that the protests were driven by frustration with the worsening economic situation, according to Reuters.

114.title: I feel those are shortcuts: 'Taare...' actor Darsheel on asking Aamir for work
114.article_body: Darsheel Safary, who started his acting career with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Taare Zameen Par', has said he could've approached Aamir for another film, but didn't feel like taking the "shortcut". "I feel those are like shortcuts," Darsheel said, adding, "Not that I want to take a long cut but a learning cut. I think I don't need to force."

115.title: US man builds own broadband to avoid high net access fee, gets ₹20 cr from govt
115.article_body: A man in US' Michigan who built his own broadband to avoid a $50,000 (around ₹40 lakh) fee to extend web access to his home, has now won a $2.6 million (₹20 crore) government bid. Network engineer Jared Mauch set up his own Internet Service Provider and got 70 customers. He's now been funded to expand to 600 additional homes.

116.title: Aamir joins Har Ghar Tiranga campaign, displays Tricolour at his house
116.article_body: Aamir Khan displayed the Tricolour at his Mumbai residence on Friday as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The campaign was introduced by PM Narendra Modi to mark 75 years of India's independence. Aamir, while reacting to 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend on Twitter, had said, "I feel sad some...people who're saying this...believe...I'm someone who doesn't like India...but it's untrue."

117.title: Coffee Day Enterprises narrows net loss to ₹18 crore in Q1
117.article_body: Coffee Day Enterprises reported a narrowing of its consolidated net loss to ₹18 crore for the quarter ended June 30 as against a net loss of ₹117.28 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its revenue from operations jumped to ₹210.49 crore as against ₹81.52 crore in the year-ago period. Its expenses also saw a 17.96% rise to ₹237.75 crore.

118.title: Direct your complaints to Kremlin: Ukraine to Russians against travel ban
118.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, "Russians who're upset with the prospect of being banned from tourist travel to Europe can direct their complaints to the Kremlin and over 70% of their compatriots who support the war." Kuleba's comments came after Ukrainian President Zelenskyy called on European Union states to ban visas for rich Russian nationals.

119.title: NMDC sets target to produce 46 million tonnes of iron ore in FY23
119.article_body: Government-owned miner NMDC Limited has set a goal to achieve 46 million tonnes of iron ore production in the current financial year, Chairman and Managing Director Sumit Deb said. This would be 10% higher than that of last year, he added. NMDC achieved the production of 42.19 MT and sales of 40.56 MT in FY22 with a ₹25,882 crore turnover.

120.title: RSS changes social media profile pics to Tricolour ahead of Independence Day
120.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) changed the display pictures of its social media accounts to the Tricolour from its traditional saffron flag. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also changed his social media profile pictures to the national flag. This comes after several political leaders criticised RSS for not changing its profile pictures amid the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign.

121.title: 200 children take part in NDRF-led National Flag rally in Hyderabad
121.article_body: Around 200 children participated in the National Flag rally led by the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) in Hyderabad's Hamidullah Nagar. "As a part of the Har Ghar Tiranga programme...we gave...National Flags to the kids and also made them aware of its significance," Shaikpet Assistant Commandant Damodhar Singh said. The event was conducted as part of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

122.title: Labourer electrocuted to death while setting up Tricolour in Chhattisgarh
122.article_body: A 36-year-old contract labourer working with the local civic body was electrocuted to death in Chhattisgarh's Korea district on Saturday. The incident took place when the deceased, identified as Suman Tigga, was erecting the national flag on a mast along with another labourer, a police official said. "His colleague Ramkripal Singh suffered injuries and is hospitalised," the official added.

123.title: BMC to spend ₹7 cr to fix pothole-ridden roads in Mumbai
123.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to spend ₹7 crore to fix pothole-ridden roads in the city. The BMC will issue the work order before Ganesh Utsav and the work will begin soon after, Additional Municipal Commissioner P Velrasu said. "We have floated tender for three new techniques for filling the potholes in Mumbai," Velrasu added.

124.title: Meghalaya CM Sangma a puppet appointed by Delhi: TMC leader
124.article_body: TMC leader Mukul Sangma on Friday said the NPP-led Meghalaya Democratic Alliance (MDA) government has been formed by PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. "CM Conrad Sangma is merely a puppet appointed by Delhi," Mukul further said. His reaction came a day after NPP announced that it will contest the Meghalaya Assembly elections alone next year.

125.title: Centre misusing central probe agencies: Tejashwi Yadav
125.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav alleged that the Centre is misusing the central probe agencies for its political gains. He also added that Mahagathbandhan will not be "scared" by such tactics. "CBI, ED, IT Department are being ruined one by one. Their condition is worse than a police station...[Bihar has] a pro-people government [and]...will work with strength," said Yadav.

126.title: SC notice to Gujarat government on Asaram’s bail plea
126.article_body: The Supreme Court has issued notice to the Gujarat government on a bail plea filed by self-styled godman Asaram Bapu. Asaram filed an appeal in the apex court against Gujarat High Court's December 10, 2021 order rejecting his bail plea in the rape case. A bench posted the case for hearing on September 7.

127.title: India resumes mango exports to US after 2 years due to pandemic
127.article_body: India resumed mango exports to the US, with over 1,000 tonne of Alphonso, Kesar and other varieties having been shipped recently. The exports were halted for two years because inspectors from the US Department of Agriculture couldn't visit India to inspect the irradiation facilities due to the travel restrictions induced by the COVID-19 pandemic.

128.title: Nothing unconventional: Roshan on relationship with Shefali in Darlings
128.article_body: Discussing his relationship with actress Shefali Shah in 'Darlings', where she's seen portraying Alia Bhatt's mother, actor Roshan Mathew said, "There is nothing unconventional...about this." "(His initial hesitation) is because of society," added Roshan. Discussing her onscreen kiss with Roshan, Shefali had said it took her by "surprise". "She does it [as] she wants to shut him up," she added.

129.title: Russia blocking access to medicines: Ukraine Health Minister
129.article_body: Ukraine's Health Minister Viktor Liashko said Russian authorities have repeatedly blocked efforts to provide state-subsidised drugs to people in areas that its forces have occupied, since invading the country in February. "We consider these actions 'to be crimes against humanity' and war crimes that will be documented and will be recognised," Liashko added, while talking to The Associated Press.

130.title: KKR franchise keen to acquire a team in women's IPL: Report
130.article_body: The Knight Riders Group, the owner of the IPL franchise KKR, is reportedly keen to own a team in the upcoming women's IPL tournament. According to a Sportskeeda report, the franchise is likely to be Kolkata-based. A source told Sportskeeda that the Knight Riders Group is keen on working with the Cricket Association of Bengal to "groom and pick players".

131.title: Top Cong leaders to meet on Aug 16 ahead of 'mega' protest on price rise
131.article_body: Ahead of "mega" protest rally against price rise and unemployment, Congress has called a meeting of all its general secretaries and state incharges on August 16 to finalise the strategy for 'Mehngai Chaupals'. The party has planned to stage a series of protests in retail markets and other locations in all Assembly constituencies from August 17 to August 23.

132.title: China's actions fundamentally at odds with goal of peace: US
132.article_body: The White House on Friday said that China's actions are fundamentally at odds with the goal of peace and stability. The comment was made in response to recent Chinese actions due to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "They are part of an intensified pressure campaign against Taiwan, which has not ended," it added.

133.title: RBI directs loan recovery agents to not harass borrowers over dues
133.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday directed banks and regulated entities to ensure that their recovery agents do not resort to harassment or intimidation of borrowers over dues. The RBI observed that the recovery agents are not following the extant instructions. It also set the timing for the call for recovery between 8 am and 7 pm.

134.title: Rosneft-backed Nayara Energy reports ₹3,564 crore profit in Q1
134.article_body: Nayara Energy, backed by Russian oil company Rosneft, reported a net profit of ₹3,563.7 crore in the April-June quarter as against a loss of ₹139.1 crore in the corresponding period last year. Its profit in the January-March quarter was ₹409.5 crore. Nayara Energy operates over 6,500 petrol pumps in the country and a refinery at Vadinar in Gujarat.

135.title: J&K govt sacks Hizbul chief's son, JKLF chief Bitta Karate's wife over terror links
135.article_body: J&K administration on Saturday sacked four government employees for alleged links with terror groups. Jammu Kashmir Liberation Front's (JKLF) terror-accused chief Bitta Karate's wife Assabha Arzoomand Khan and Hizbul Mujahideen chief Syed Salahuddin's son Syed Abdul Mueed are reportedly among them. Khan was a Jammu and Kashmir Administrative Service officer. Mueed worked as an IT manager.

136.title: Government cannot deny benefits to non-religious people: Kerala HC
136.article_body: Kerala High Court said that citizens from economically weaker sections cannot be denied benefits because they do not identify with a religion. "The government has to formulate a policy for issuing certificates to persons like petitioners who've declared themselves to be non-religious," it added. "A government that claims to be progressive cannot deny benefits to such citizens," HC stated.

137.title: SUV hits parked truck as driver tries to save cow in Maha; 4 dead
137.article_body: Four people were killed and one other person was injured after an SUV rammed into a parked truck in Maharashtra's Chandrapur, police said on Saturday. The accident occurred after the SUV's driver lost control over the vehicle while trying to save a cow sitting on the road, an assistant inspector said. The injured person was taken to a hospital.

138.title: China to send fighter jets & bombers to Thailand for military drills
138.article_body: China is sending fighter jets and bombers to Thailand for a joint exercise with the Thai military on Sunday. The Chinese Defence Ministry said that the training will include air support, strikes on ground targets and small- and large-scale troop deployment. The training comes as the US holds military drills in Indonesia with Indonesia, Australia, Japan and Singapore.

139.title: Noida woman grabs e-rickshaw driver's collar, slaps him 17 times for hitting her car
139.article_body: A video showing a woman slapping an e-rickshaw driver at least 17 times for allegedly hitting her car in Noida has surfaced online. The woman can be seen grabbing the man by his collar and taking him to the car. The woman can also be seen asking the man for his e-rickshaw's keys and forcefully checking his pockets.

140.title: Earlier Indian flag was burnt, today it can be hoisted across J&K: Thakur
140.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has said that in the past, the Indian flag was burnt in Jammu and Kashmir but now it can be hoisted anywhere. "After the abrogation of Article 370 and Article 35A under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, now one can hoist the national flag in any corner of J&K," Thakur said.

141.title: Revenue department official arrested for taking ₹25,000 bribe in Jammu
141.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested a revenue department official in Jammu for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹25,000. The accused had reportedly demanded a bribe of ₹50,000 from the complainant for issuing documents of land owned by him. CBI then laid a trap and arrested the accused. Cash worth ₹2 lakh was also recovered during searches, CBI said.

142.title: The schedule is broken: Styris on Boult giving up NZ central contract
142.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's Trent Boult, the current world number one ODI bowler, giving up his central contract, ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said, "It's...a bigger message that the schedule is broken." "Cricket can't afford to lose the likes of Ben Stokes and Boult...away from the international game," added Styris. "Nobody...thought...Boult is going to finish up...this soon," he stated.

143.title: PCMC says it's filled 1,800 potholes at the cost of ₹1 crore
143.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has said that it's filled 1,800 potholes or 88% of potholes in its jurisdiction at the cost of ₹1 crore. It'd taken time to fill potholes due to continuous rains, PCMC City Engineer (Civil) Makarand Nikam said. "We need...long dry spell so that pothole filling work can be carried out to last long," Nikam added.

144.title: 14-15 of my films had not worked a few yrs ago, so I thought of moving to Canada: Akshay
144.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about holding a Canadian passport, said he "is an Indian, from India, and will always remain so". "A few years ago, my films weren't working. Almost 14-15 films hadn't worked...I thought I should probably move elsewhere and work there," he added. Akshay further said after he began experiencing professional success again, he decided he should stay back.

145.title: Oppn ready with 'waiting list' of PM candidates without vacancy: Naqvi
145.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said the Opposition has already prepared a "waiting list of two dozen prime ministerial candidates" even when there is no vacancy for the post. He further added that "those suffering from political disease of Modi phobia will vanish soon". The former Union Minister was addressing a programme in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district.

146.title: Sameer Wankhede gets clean chit in certificate case; panel says 'not Muslim by birth'
146.article_body: A Maharashtra caste scrutiny committee gave a clean chit to former NCB Zonal Director Sameer Wankhede in caste certificate case stating he wasn't a Muslim by birth. "It's not proven Wankhede and his father converted to Islam...they belonged to Mahar-37 Scheduled Caste," the order reads. Wankhede used a fake certificate to get government jobs, former minister Nawab Malik had claimed.

147.title: Astronaut sends I-Day greetings to India from Space Station, govt shares video
147.article_body: Ahead of India's Independence Day on August 15, astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti sent greetings from the International Space Station (ISS). In a video shared by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), the astronaut said, "It's a pleasure to congratulate India on 75 years of Independence." She also mentioned international agencies' cooperation with ISRO on the NISAR Earth Science Mission.

148.title: 5 die in Bihar's Saran, suspected to have consumed hooch
148.article_body: At least five people have died in Bihar's Saran district allegedly after consuming spurious liquor. "It is being said that these people died after consuming alcohol, however, it is not yet confirmed if they actually drank it," the Sub-Divisional Magistrate said. Around 10-12 people were arrested on Friday night after police personnel raided the Marhaura area in Saran.

149.title: Bombay HC orders ₹2 lakh as damages for wrongly keeping Nigerian man in jail
149.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the Maharashtra government to pay ₹2 lakh to a Nigerian man jailed since October 2020 on the basis of an erroneous forensic report. The court has ordered to recover the amount from the errant officer of a forensic science laboratory, which has admitted its official's mistake. The judgement was given by Justice Bharati Dangre.

150.title: 1 killed, dozens injured as music festival stage collapses in Spain
150.article_body:
At least one person was killed and dozens others were injured after high winds caused part of a stage to collapse at a music festival in Spain on Saturday, regional emergency services said. Another infrastructure was also reportedly damaged when gusts battered the Medusa Festival. 
Of those wounded, three people have suffered serious trauma injuries, the emergency services added.

151.title: Don't know how he's feeling, I don't sleep with Haaland, jokes Guardiola
151.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola jokingly said he doesn't know how striker Erling Haaland is feeling after playing two games for the club, adding he doesn't "sleep" with him. "I am not at home with Haaland so I don't know how he handles it," added Guardiola. "People said he was a failure and...everyone laughed at him," Guardiola had earlier stated.

152.title: Telegram gets approval for app update after CEO blames Apple for delay
152.article_body: Telegram has released its new iOS update after getting approval from Apple. Earlier this week, Telegram CEO Pavel Durov had complained about the update being "stuck in Apple's review for two weeks". In a new post, Durov said the approval was granted after Telegram accepted Apple's demand to remove "Telemoji", vector-animated versions of the standard emoji, from the update.

153.title: 7 MP BJYM office-bearers removed from posts over ruckus at temple
153.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) has removed seven officer-bearers from their posts for allegedly creating ruckus at the Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain earlier this week. The incident occurred during the organisation's National President and BJP MP Tejasvi Surya's visit. State BJYM President Vaibhav Pawar issued a list of 18 workers and leaders involved in the incident.

154.title: Canara Bank cheated of ₹2.71 cr by fake companies in Hyderabad
154.article_body: Two fake companies allegedly cheated Hyderabad's Balanagar branch of Canara Bank of ₹2.71 crore by taking loans and not repaying them. A company AFS Constructions reportedly took a loan of ₹1.3 crore from the bank and officials later found that this was a fictional company. Similarly, ₹1.41 crore was given to Tirumala Enterprises Civil Engineering company based on fake documents.

155.title: 22-year-old woman in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 5th case in national capital
155.article_body: Delhi has reported its fifth confirmed monkeypox case in a 22-year-old woman. "The patient was admitted to Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital (LNJP) and her sample tested positive for monkeypox on Friday," MD LNJP Hospital Dr Suresh Kumar said. "At present, four patients are admitted, one discharged. Total five cases have been so far reported here," Kumar added.

156.title: What has Aamir done to deserve this: Mona on boycott 'Laal Singh...' trend
156.article_body: Actress Mona Singh, reacting to the calls to boycott Aamir Khan-starrer film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "I was very sad." "What has Aamir done to deserve this? He's a guy who has...entertained us for...last 30 years," Mona said, adding, "But I was very confident that...boycotters would come around once they started seeing that the film is resonating with every Indian."

157.title: Authorities take away pit bull that attacked woman in Gurugram
157.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram on Friday took custody of the pet pit bull that attacked and severely injured a woman on Thursday in the Civil Lines area. The dog will remain under a veterinary doctor's observation, an official said. On the basis of the doctor's report, the dog will either be returned to its owner or sent for training.

158.title: 2 B'luru hospitals directed to reserve beds for high-risk COVID patients
158.article_body: Amid a surge in COVID-19 infections, the Karnataka health department has directed two COVID-19 care hospitals in Bengaluru to reserve beds for high-risk patients. The directive has been issued for CV Raman General Hospital and Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College Hospital. Notably, Bengaluru has reported over 1,000 COVID-19 cases on at least five days since July 27.

159.title: 'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun declines ₹10 crore deal to promote liquor brand: Report
159.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' actor Allu Arjun has reportedly rejected an offer to promote a liquor brand. According to Manobala Vijayabalan, a columnist and film industry tracker, Allu Arjun declined a ₹10 crore deal from a gutkha and liquor brand. Currently, he is charging ₹7.5 crore for brand endorsements, Vijayabalan's tweet further read.

160.title: Mumbai Police bust mobile stealing gang; 12 arrested in last 1 month
160.article_body: The Mumbai Police have busted a mobile stealing gang and have arrested 12 people in connection in the last one month. The police have been able to recover over 700 mobile phones, which were stolen from various parts of Mumbai, police said. The gang allegedly used to send good-quality stolen phones to Bangladesh while older ones were sold in India.

161.title: Portfolios to be allocated soon: Maharashtra Deputy CM Fadnavis
161.article_body: Talking about the new cabinet, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that portfolios will be allocated to the newly-appointed ministers soon. Eknath Shinde expanded his cabinet 41 days after taking oath as the Chief Minister. He inducted 18 ministers, nine from the BJP and nine from his rebel Shiv Sena group.

162.title: 9-day-old baby gets hit by stone pelted by drunk man in UP, dies
162.article_body: A nine-day-old baby died on Friday after she was hit by one of the stones that a drunk man had hurled at some people in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj. The man had climbed the roof of his house and started pelting stones on being confronted by people whom he'd abused, the SP said. The infant died during treatment, the SP added.

163.title: IAS Shah Faesal, who quit civil services to join politics, reinstated in Central govt
163.article_body: IAS officer Shah Faesal has been appointed as Deputy Secretary in the Union Tourism Ministry. Faesal, who became the first Kashmiri to top the civil services exam in 2010, was reinstated in the services earlier this year. He quit civil services in 2019 and later floated his own political party. The 39-year-old quit politics the following year.

164.title: Sunak criticised for building huge swimming pool at his manor as UK faces drought
164.article_body: UK's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak is being criticised for building a huge swimming pool at his luxury mansion after an official drought was declared across large parts of the country. Aerial pictures showing the construction of the 12-metre by 5-metre swimming pool have also surfaced. As per reports, the construction of the pool is estimated to cost about £400,000.

165.title: Govt hasn't given a timeline for selling IDBI stake: LIC Chairman
165.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC), which owns a 49.2% stake in IDBI Bank, said that the government hasn't given it any timeline for IDBI stake sale. LIC Chairman MR Kumar said that the divestment department is working on it but so far no expression of interest has been called in. He added there has been no formal proposal from the department.

166.title: We disagree with the order: Vauld as ED freezes assets worth ₹370 cr
166.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) froze assets worth ₹370 crore of the crypto lending platform Vauld's Indian arm, Flipvolt, for allegedly assisting predatory lending apps, the company has come out with a statement saying, "We respectfully disagree with the freezing order." Vauld further said that it strictly adheres to KYC requirements in every country, including India.

167.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie appalling, reprehensible: US
167.article_body: The attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in New York is "appalling" and "reprehensible", US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said. "All of us in the Biden-Harris Administration are praying for his speedy recovery," he added. Rushdie, who wrote 'The Satanic Verses', was stabbed by a 24-year-old man when he was about to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution.

168.title: Class 11 girl raped by self-proclaimed doctor in UP, probe launched
168.article_body: A self-proclaimed doctor allegedly raped a class 11 girl in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur district, police said on Friday. The incident reportedly occurred a month ago when the girl had visited the doctor for chest pain treatment. "A probe has been ordered into the medical degrees of the so-called doctor and a search is on for him," police said.

169.title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda hoist Tricolour as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
169.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, along with his wife, on Saturday, hoisted the Tricolour at his residence in New Delhi as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "Tiranga is our pride. It unites and inspires everyone Indian," he tweeted. BJP national president JP Nadda also hoisted the Tricolour with his family at his residence in New Delhi.

170.title: Sincere Gratitude: Taiwan thanks US for maintaining security in region
170.article_body: Taiwan's Foreign Ministry expressed "sincere gratitude" towards the US for taking "concrete actions" to maintain security and peace in the Taiwan Strait and the region. US Indo-Pacific coordinator Kurt Campbell on Friday had said that China "overreacted" to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. China launched military drills around the self-ruled island in response to the visit.

171.title: Small plane crash lands on busy road, bursts into flames in US; video surfaces
171.article_body: A video of a small plane crash landing on a busy road and bursting into flames in US' California has surfaced online. The video shows the plane sliding to the side of the road amid plumes of smoke after catching fire. "The plane broke apart and ignited. The two occupants were able to safely exit the wreckage," fire department said.

172.title: Unnao rape survivor seeks transfer of case to Delhi
172.article_body: The Unnao rape survivor has filed a petition in the Supreme Court seeking transfer of a criminal case against her to Delhi. She said that the case before the Unnao court is being pursued with the "oblique motive to intimidate, silence and harass" her. She claimed that there is a grave threat to her life in Unnao.

173.title: Sambit Patra criticises Delhi CM over freebies culture
173.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal over freebies culture. "Kejriwal has just one goal to establish the prominence of AAP in the country...Freebies are baits to lure [people] so that the ambitions of Arvind Kejriwal get fulfilled. He acts as if he is worried for the entire world but he is worried only about himself," said Patra.

174.title: Babar's rough patch won't continue that long: Aaqib Javed on Kohli
174.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Babar Azam is a technically sound player and his rough patch won't continue as long as Virat Kohli. "Kohli gets stuck...with...deliveries outside off-stump. James Anderson has targeted that a million times," added Javed. "Kohli is now...trying not to play those deliveries from a distance. When you change your technique, these problems...surface," he stated.
