175.title: Dr Soni recommends Skin Foods Glow Mix over anti-ageing creams: Kapiva
175.article_body: Kapiva revealed its Skin Foods Glow Mix with 10+ Ayurvedic herbs works on inner layers of skin, unlike creams and serums that work on outer layer that gets replaced every 27 days. Research says that skin, the largest organ starts ageing in the 20s, Kapiva stated, adding that Glow Mix aids nutrition, naturally boosts collagen, glutathione and hyaluronic acid synthesis.

176.title: India to miss year-end renewable energy target: Experts
176.article_body: India is going to miss the renewable energy target for the end of the year because of several shortcomings such as taxes on imported components and lack of financial help, experts said. The country had set the target in January 2018 that would have increased the renewable energy capacity to 43% of its current energy mix.

177.title: CUET-UG postponed for 11,000 Phase-4 candidates from August 17-20 to August 30
177.article_body: The University Grants Commission (UGC) has said that CUET-UG for 11,000 out of the 3.72 lakh candidates who were scheduled to appear in the fourth phase has been postponed. Their exam has been postponed from August 17-20 to August 30 to accommodate their choice of city for exam centre, UGC Chairman Jagadesh Kumar said.

178.title: Man, his father assault his wife over dowry in Noida; arrested
178.article_body: A man and his father were arrested for allegedly assaulting his wife and three of her family members over dowry in Noida, the police said on Friday. The assault had occurred during an argument while the woman's family was visiting, the SHO said. A case has also been filed against the woman's brother-in-law, who is absconding, the police added.

179.title: Woman kills 5-yr-old daughter, dumps her body near Golden Temple; CCTV footage surfaces
179.article_body: A woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her five-year-old daughter and dumping her body near Golden Temple in Punjab's Amritsar. CCTV footage showed the woman carrying the girl. Police said that after dumping the girl's body, the woman approached a police station in Rajpura claiming her daughter had gone missing.

180.title: UP CM Yogi's pics defaced in hoardings in Firozabad; cases filed
180.article_body: Two cases have been filed after pictures of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath were found defaced in several 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' hoardings in Firozabad, officials said. While District Magistrate Ravi Ranjan said that Yogi's face was removed from three hoardings put up by the municipal body, a BJP leader claimed that the hoardings at six places were disfigured.

181.title: Misconception that a parallel Shiv Sena Bhavan is being made by Shinde camp: Maha minister
181.article_body: Maharashtra minister Uday Samant said there is a misconception that a parallel Shiv Sena Bhavan is being made by the Eknath Shinde faction in Dadar. "However, we're trying to find a central office so that the CM can meet common people," Samant tweeted. This comes amid Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's claim that his faction is the "real Shiv Sena".

182.title: Mass fish die-off in German-Polish river; cause unknown
182.article_body: Huge numbers of dead fish have washed up on the banks of the Oder River, which runs through Germany and Poland, in recent weeks. German and Polish authorities are working "flat-out" to establish the cause behind this "mass die-out and minimise potential further damage", German Environment Minister Steffi Lemke said. Officials have warned people not to enter the water.

183.title: Box office collection of Aamir's 'Laal...' drops by 40% on Day 2
183.article_body: The box office collection of Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' dropped by 40 percent on day two, after collecting approximately ₹7 crore, according to Box Office India. The film had earlier recorded Aamir's lowest opening in the last 13 years. Approximately 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have been reduced by exhibitors due to low turnout, reported Bollywood Hungama.

184.title: Govt lists ways to avoid incorrect display of the National Flag
184.article_body: Amid 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, the government has stated that the National Flag should not be displayed in an inverted manner and it shouldn't be damaged or disheveled. No other flag or bunting shall be placed higher than or above or side by side with the Tricolour. The flag shouldn't be allowed to touch the ground or trail in water.

185.title: 40-yr-old man accused in 8 cases of elephant poaching arrested in Odisha
185.article_body: Forest officials in Odisha have arrested a 40-year-old man accused in at least eight cases of elephant poaching. The accused used to illegally smuggle elephant tusks from Badamba area of Athagarh forest division to Kolkata, said Athagarh DFO Sudarshan Gopinath Yadav. This comes after the Environment Ministry sought a report from the state government regarding action taken against poachers.

186.title: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi tests positive for COVID-19 again
186.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said on Saturday. "She will remain in isolation as per government protocol," Ramesh tweeted. This comes after Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tested positive for COVID-19 on August 10. India reported 15,815 new COVID-19 cases in the past 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry.

187.title: Headless body of woman in her 20s found in drain in UP
187.article_body: A headless body of a woman, believed to be in her twenties, was found in the Lakkhipura area of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut district on Friday. Her body was first spotted by locals in a drain. Police said that teams have been formed to contact locals and collect details of any missing women in the area.

188.title: Man on his way to celebrate Rakhi dies after Chinese manjha slits his neck in Delhi
188.article_body: A 34-year-old man on his way to celebrate Raksha Bandhan was killed after a Chinese manjha (glass-coated string) slit his neck at Shastri Park flyover in Delhi on Thursday. Police said the deceased was on a motorcycle along with his wife and daughter at the time of the incident. The sale of Chinese manjha is banned in Delhi.

189.title: Narcotics worth ₹100 crore seized at Chennai airport; 1 arrested
189.article_body: Customs officials intercepted a passenger at the Chennai airport and seized narcotics, including heroin and cocaine, worth ₹100 crore from him, officials said on Friday. The man, who has been arrested, had hidden the narcotics in his check-in baggage and footwear, according to an official statement. The seized narcotics weighed a total of 9.59 kg, the official statement said.

190.title: Gunman kills 10 after family dispute in Montenegro
190.article_body: A gunman killed at least 10 people and injured six others in a shooting in Montenegro's Cetinje city on Friday following a family dispute. According to officials, the gunman shot dead three members of the same family who were staying at his house before randomly shooting passers-by. The gunman was later killed after firing at police, public broadcaster RTCG said.

191.title: Adani Group's acquisition of Ambuja Cements, ACC approved by CCI
191.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Adani Group's acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC from Switzerland's Holcim. Adani Group had acquired the companies in May for ₹81,339 crore. The CCI gave the approval to Endeavour Trade and Investment, a company incorporated in Mauritius by the Adani Group. Adani Group is now the country's second-largest cement player after UltraTech.

192.title: Assam CM suspends 3 policemen after 13-yr-old girl found hanging
192.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma suspended three senior police officers from Darrang following allegations of dereliction of duty against them. This comes after a 13-year-old girl was allegedly found hanging inside a house in Dhula in June. Police allegedly displayed dereliction of duty in collecting evidence and an officer put pressure on the deceased's family to not file a complaint.

193.title: We're here to challenge really hard: Zimbabwe head coach on ODIs vs India
193.article_body: Zimbabwe head coach Dave Houghton said his team will look to challenge Team India "really hard" during the three-match ODI series, having defeated Bangladesh in the recently concluded T20I and ODI series. "We aren't here just to add up to...numbers...but...to challenge," added Houghton. "We're playing the strongest side in the world...I'd still expect us to...compete really well," he stated.

194.title: Free bus rides for women 'economic revolution' not 'freebie': TN CM
194.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday said free bus travel provided to women by the state government was an 'economic revolution' and shouldn't be categorised as 'freebies.' "Due to this scheme...families see 8-12% savings in their income which I would call...economic revolution," Stalin added. He noted that over 80% of beneficiaries were from backward classes and Adi Dravidar communities.

195.title: 31-year-old Bhojpuri singer arrested with 21 kg ganja in Delhi
195.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday said that they have arrested a 31-year-old singer-turned-drug peddler identified as Vinay Sharma with 21.5 kg ganja in the city. Sharma, who is a resident of Bihar's Siwan, has sung over 100 Bhojpuri songs, police stated. "Further efforts are going on to trace the source of the contraband," they added.

196.title: August rainfall helps major Pune dams reach full capacity: Report
196.article_body: Rainfall in the month of August has helped all major dams in Pune that supply drinking water to the city reach their full capacity, reported Indian Express. On Friday, Panshet dam remained at 99.27% capacity despite releasing water into Khadakwasla dam earlier, the report said. While Khadakwasla dam had reached 100% capacity on Wednesday following the discharge, the report added.

197.title: After declaring COVID victory, N Korea lifts mask mandate, other curbs
197.article_body: After North Korean leader Kim Jong-un declared victory over COVID-19 this week, North Korea has dropped a face mask mandate and other social distancing rules, state media reported on Saturday. The anti-epidemic measures were imposed in May after the country announced its first COVID-19 outbreak. North Korea had blamed the outbreak on "alien things" near its border with South Korea.

198.title: India will beat Pakistan and win the Asia Cup 2022: Ricky Ponting
198.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting said India will beat Pakistan in their Asia Cup match on August 28 in Dubai, adding that the former will go on to win the tournament as well. "India's depth is definitely better than the other teams," stated Ponting. Pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel have been ruled out of the Asia Cup.

199.title: What was the fatwa issued by Iran against Salman Rushdie in 1989?
199.article_body: In 1989, the then Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini issued a fatwa against Salman Rushdie. Khomeini called for Rushdie to be killed for writing 'The Satanic Verses', which the cleric said insulted Islam. The British government had granted police protection to Rushdie after a $2.8-million bounty was put on the writer's head.

200.title: She liked her role: 'Puli' maker on Sridevi choosing it over 'Baahubali'
200.article_body: Talking about late actress Sridevi choosing his film 'Puli' over SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning', the film's director Chimbu Deven said, "She liked her role in 'Puli'." Rajamouli had earlier said they were "lucky" that Sridevi "rejected" the role, eventually played by Ramya Krishnan. "I was shocked and hurt...[It] made me feel very sad," Sridevi had reacted to Rajamouli's remark.

201.title: Questionable: Ex-selector Karim on India having 7 captains so far in 2022
201.article_body: With India having had seven captains so far in 2022, former selector Saba Karim said, "This kind of change in captaincy trend is strange and questionable." "Such decisions need to be taken very cautiously. There's no need to rush," added Karim. "It affects the morale of the cricketer," he stated. KL Rahul will lead India in the ODIs against Zimbabwe.

202.title: Noida woman kills husband as he finds out about her extra-marital affair
202.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly strangling her 30-year-old husband to death after he found out about her alleged extra-marital affair, Noida Police said. "The accused, in a fit of rage, strangled the deceased with her dupatta and bashed his head against the wall," police added. The deceased was married to the accused for 10 years, police further said.

203.title: RCP Singh was inducted into Union Cabinet without my consent: Bihar CM
203.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has said that RCP Singh was inducted into the Union Cabinet without his consent. "He was the national chief and I did not approve of the development...I said in 2019 that we should get at least four berths...Agreeing to anything less than that would have sent a bad message," said Kumar.

204.title: Info Edge not in a hurry to sell Zomato, Policybazaar stakes: Founder
204.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani said on Friday that the company isn't in a "tearing hurry" to sell its stakes in Zomato and Policybazaar. Info Edge had sold shares worth ₹357 crore in Zomato's initial public offering while retaining a 15.3% stake. It hadn't sold any of its shares in Policybazaar parent PB Fintech's IPO and holds a 13.3% stake.

205.title: MoS Muraleedharan demands resignation of CPI(M) MLA over 'Azad Kashmir' remark
205.article_body: Union Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised CPI(M) MLA KT Jaleel over his "Azad Kashmir" remark. "An elected MLA of Kerala saying that the Kashmir which is part of India, is an Indian occupied Kashmir and describing the Kashmir which has been occupied by Pakistan as Azad Kashmir. It is nothing less than treason," Muraleedharan said.

206.title: Entire police staff at Rohtak check post suspended for not filing FIR
206.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Friday ordered the suspension of the entire police staff at Rohtak's Sukhpura check post for negligence after an advocate accused the police personnel of not registering an FIR. "When I reached...check post...staff was under...influence of alcohol and they didn't lodge my complaint," the advocate claimed. Vij was chairing a grievances redressal committee meeting.

207.title: Absconding brother-in-law of Rajasthan BJP MLA arrested in murder case
207.article_body: A local Rajasthan MLA Shobharani Kushwah's brother-in-law and another man, both of who were absconding for a decade in a murder case, have been arrested, police said. The two were arrested from Sepau bypass crossing, Dholpur SP Dharmendra Singh added. The case pertains to the murder of a man who was shot dead on December 27, 2012, in Dholpur.

208.title: Nigerian national arrested with 30 grams of MDMA in Hyderabad
208.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW), along with Narayanguda police, on Friday arrested a Nigerian national for peddling drugs. Police also seized 30 grams of MDMA, ₹4,000 cash and four cell phones, all worth ₹3 lakh. The accused was illegally residing in Hyderabad, police said, adding that 108 consumers, who were purchasing drugs from the accused, have been identified.

209.title: EU should not be a supermarket for rich Russians: Ukraine Prez
209.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged European Union states to ban visas for Russian nationals. "Europe must...not be transformed into a supermarket where it's not important who walks in and where the main thing is that people just pay for their goods," he added. Zelenskyy said his proposal didn't apply to Russians who needed help from the "civilised world".

210.title: Pujara smashes 22 runs off 1 over, slams hundred off 73 deliveries in one-day match
210.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 22 runs off one over while playing for Sussex against Warwickshire in a Royal London One-Day Cup match and reached his hundred off 73 deliveries in the match. Pujara slammed three fours, two doubles and a six off Warwickshire pacer Liam Norwell in the 45th over. Pujara scored 107 runs off 79 deliveries.

211.title: YouTube working to launch streaming video services: Report
211.article_body: YouTube is planning to launch an online store for streaming video services, The Wall Street Journal reported on Friday. The report mentioned that the company has been working on the same for about 18 months now and has renewed talks with entertainment companies for participation. This will let YouTube join companies such as Roku and Apple in the streaming market.

212.title: Flying umbrella pierces woman's chest at US beach; police say 'Winds threw it into her'
212.article_body: A woman was killed after a flying beach umbrella pierced her chest in South Carolina, authorities said. The umbrella was blown from its anchoring by the wind, with police saying it was "thrown into the victim". The US Consumer Product Safety Commission estimates about 3,000 people are injured by beach umbrellas every year.

213.title: 1 dead, 9 injured as lightning strikes zinc plant in Rajasthan
213.article_body: One man was burnt to death and nine others were seriously injured after an acid tank exploded due to lightning at Hindustan Zinc plant in Rajasthan on Friday. The incident occurred in Chittorgarh district following which ten employees suffered burn injuries. They were rushed to district hospital where one of them died during treatment, Additional SP Kailash Singh Sandhu said.

214.title: BJP won 140 out of 186 seats in Goa Panchayat elections: CM Sawant
214.article_body: BJP has won over 140 seats out of 186 seats in the Goa Panchayat elections, state CM Pramod Sawant said on Friday. The state BJP President Sadanand Shet Tanavade told ANI that this is the "first time" in Goa Panchayat elections that "any party has won so many seats". Goa had reported a 78.7% voter turnout in the Panchayat elections.

215.title: Utterly horrified: Tharoor after author Salman Rushdie stabbed on stage in US
215.article_body: After India-born author Salman Rushdie was stabbed multiple times on stage in New York, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted that he's "utterly horrified and shocked" by the incident. "With a sinking heart, I recognize that life for him can never be the same again. A sad day, worse if creative expression can no longer be free & open," Tharoor wrote.

216.title: People walked out of my debut film 'Josh', it 'scarred' me: Naga
216.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who features in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said people "walked" out of his debut film 'Josh' which hit him "hard", adding that it "scarred" him. "A lot of people go for the first day. I can't because I am a wreck. I have severe anxiety problems on the day the film is releasing," added Naga.

217.title: 6 more bodies recovered after boat capsizes in UP's Banda; death toll reaches 9
217.article_body: At least six more bodies have been recovered from Kishanpur ghat in Uttar Pradesh's Banda after a boat capsized in the Yamuna on Thursday. A total of nine bodies have been recovered so far. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of those killed.

218.title: India reports 15,815 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,19,264
218.article_body: India has reported 15,815 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,561 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,19,264, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,996, according to the latest data.

219.title: Mangaluru school asks students to remove 'rakhis'; apologises after protests
219.article_body: A Christian missionary school in Karnataka's Mangaluru allegedly asked its students to remove 'rakhis' claiming that 'jewellery' was not allowed in the school. It later issued an apology following protests by the parents of at least 20 students. "We uphold the values of all religions. The incident was a mistake by some of our staff members," the school's in-charge said.

220.title: Ratan Tata receives Tricolour under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign; govt shares pic
220.article_body: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was presented with the National Flag ahead of the Independence Day under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The government also shared a picture of the flag being presented to the industrialist. Under the campaign, people have been urged to hoist or display the National Flag at their homes between August 13 and 15.

221.title: Paraguay Vice Prez Velazquez to resign after US sanctions
221.article_body: Paraguayan Vice President Hugo Velazquez on Friday said he would resign next week and withdraw his candidacy for the presidency after he was sanctioned by the US for "significant corruption". Velazquez denied the US allegations and insisted he has "a clear conscience". Velazquez, who is barred from entering the US, said his resignation would be offered to "protect" his party.

222.title: Who are the Ballon d'Or nominees as Messi not included for 1st time since 2005?
222.article_body: Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi hasn't been nominated for Ballon d'Or 2022. It's the first time since 2005 that Messi has not made it to the 30-man shortlist for the award. Meanwhile, Cristiano Ronaldo is on the Ballon d'Or shortlist for the 18th year in a row. Other nominees include Robert Lewandowski, Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland, among others.

223.title: I only want to work for people like him: Employee fired by CEO who posted crying selfie
223.article_body: After HyperSocial's CEO Braden Wallake's crying selfie went viral, an employee who was laid off by him said he's only interested in working for people like Wallake. Noah Smith was told that the company didn't have funds to continue employing him. "I was a bit shocked, but didn't feel any immediate rush of anger or resentment," Smith wrote on LinkedIn.

224.title: India's industrial output grows 12.3% in June: Govt data
224.article_body: India’s industrial output, measured through the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a 12.3% growth in June, data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation showed on Friday. The manufacturing and electricity sectors led the growth. IIP growth in June 2021 was 13.8%. The industrial growth in the April-June period of the current fiscal rose by 12.7%.

225.title: Businessman's ₹193-cr superyacht with 5 rooms, pool bursts into flames in Spain
225.article_body: A superyacht worth around £20 million (₹193 crore) belonging to Italian businessman Paolo Scudieri went up in flames near Formentera island in Spain. All five bedrooms, gym and swimming pool in the yacht named Aria SF are said to be destroyed after the fire. Emergency services said nine passengers and seven crew were rescued from the Aria SF.

226.title: Arsenal's Granit Xhaka picks winning Champions League over World Cup
226.article_body: Arsenal midfielder and Switzerland captain Granit Xhaka picked winning the Champions League over winning the World Cup during an interview. Xhaka further chose to finish in the top four of the Premier League, which ensures Champions League qualification in comparison to winning the FA Cup. Xhaka named Cristiano Ronaldo when asked to choose between Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

227.title: I was very frustrated: Fàbregas on throwing pizza at Sir Alex in 2004
227.article_body: Recollecting Arsenal's 0-2 defeat against Manchester United in October 2004, which ended his team's 49-game unbeaten run, ex-Arsenal midfielder Cesc Fàbregas said, "I was very frustrated." "We started hearing noises...I didn't have the...courage maybe to go into that fight. They were monsters in there...I threw a slice of pizza and...it hit [United manager] Sir Alex Ferguson," he added.

228.title: 72-year-old man jumps in front of metro train in Gurugram, dies
228.article_body: A 72-year-old man died after he jumped in front of an approaching train at the Guru Dronacharya Metro Station in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The police added that a suicide note was found in the deceased's pocket. "The man didn't blame anyone in...suicide note for his extreme step," a station house officer said. The incident occurred at 4.56 pm.

229.title: Bajaj Group gives 5 lakh National Flags to PMC for free distribution
229.article_body: Bajaj Group has handed over five lakh National Flags to the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for free distribution. This comes as the civic body decided to distribute flags for free to every household in the city to ensure flag hoisting under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' initiative. "Bajaj family is a family of freedom fighters," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

230.title: Top secret files found at Trump's home; ex-US Prez suspected of violating Espionage Act
230.article_body: The FBI seized top secret files in a search of former US President Donald Trump's estate in Florida this week, according to a search warrant. The warrant indicates that FBI agents were looking into potential violations of the Espionage Act, which makes it illegal to keep or transmit potentially dangerous national security information. Agents removed 11 sets of documents.

231.title: 6,000 posts of Anganwadi workers will be filled in 45 days: Punjab CM Mann
231.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said that 6,000 posts of Anganwadi workers will be filled in 45 days. The entire recruitment will be merit-based and no bribe and recommendation will work, he added. As many as 4,300 Punjab Police posts are being filled and appointment letters would be given to those selected in the coming days, Mann stated.

232.title: British PM, French Prez condemn 'cowardly' attack on Salman Rushdie
232.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in New York, French President Emmanuel Macron said, "For 33 years...Rushdie has embodied freedom and the fight against obscurantism. He has just been the victim of a cowardly attack by the forces of hatred and barbarism...We stand by his side." UK PM Boris Johnson said he was "appalled" by the attack.

233.title: 'Laal...' isn't Aamir's biopic: Mona on criticism over playing his mother
233.article_body: Reacting to criticism over playing Aamir Khan's mother in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' at the age of 40 with Aamir 57 years old, actress Mona Singh said, "It is not...Aamir's...biopic...That would be wrong." "I was so confident...that most people won't question the age gap after seeing the film," added Mona. "What's the logic...This is wrong," Aamir had responded to the criticism.

234.title: Karnataka reports 2,032 new COVID-19 cases, 1,202 from B'luru alone
234.article_body: Karnataka reported 2,032 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Friday, out of which 1,202 cases were recorded in Bengaluru alone. According to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath, no deaths were reported in the city on Friday. With 7,102 active COVID-19 cases, the test positivity rate in Bengaluru now stands at 6.94%, data showed.

235.title: I am a Chinese, not a terrorist: Huawei India CEO reportedly tells Delhi court
235.article_body: Huawei India's CEO Li Xiongwei told a Delhi court, "I am a Chinese (national) and not a terrorist," in response to the Income Tax Department's opposition to his bail plea, the ET reported. India doesn't have an extradition treaty with China and if Xiongwei leaves, it would be tough to bring him back for trial, the Department told the court.

236.title: 2 persons from Mumbai held in Pune with mephedrone worth ₹7.56 lakh
236.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Pune City Police's crime branch arrested two residents of Mumbai with 54 grams of mephedrone (MD) worth ₹7.56 lakh near Khadi Machine Chowk in Kondhwa. Police acted on a tip-off and laid a trap to arrest the suspected drug peddlers. After the operation, police also recovered cell phones and some cash from the accused.

237.title: Drunk air hostess, friends create ruckus at restaurant, break car's windshield in Jaipur
237.article_body: A drunk air hostess and her three friends allegedly created a ruckus at a Jaipur restaurant after getting into an argument with a family, police said. She also allegedly broke the windshield of the car belonging to the family with a beer bottle. Police said the air hostess and five others were arrested in connection with the case.

238.title: India-China relationship can't be normal as border situation is not normal: Govt
238.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday said, "We have maintained our position that if China disturbs the peace and tranquillity in border areas, it will impact our relations." "Our relationship is not normal, it cannot be normal as the border situation is not normal," he further said.

239.title: Hyd Traffic Police issues advisory ahead of tricoloured balloons programme
239.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued an advisory ahead of the release of tricoloured balloons at Upper Tankbund on Saturday. According to the advisory, from 9:30 am to 12:30 pm, traffic from Liberty towards Upper Tankbund will be diverted at Ambedkar statue towards Telugu Thalli, Iqbal Minar. Parking places have also been notified in the advisory.

240.title: 34-yr-old dies as throat slit by kite string while riding bike in Delhi
240.article_body: A 34-year-old man died after his throat was slit by glass-coated kite string ('manjha') in Delhi's Shastri Park area on Friday, police said. The man was with his wife and their eight-year-old daughter when the accident happened, police added. "The driver of an ambulance which was passing by stopped and took the family to the hospital," the deceased's nephew said.

241.title: 53-year-old Anne Heche declared legally dead days after car crash, family confirms
241.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who had been in a coma since a car crash in Los Angeles last week, has been declared legally dead, her family confirmed. Her representative said that she is legally dead according to California law, but she is still on life support as medical professionals are assessing if any of her organs can be donated.

242.title: Bear possibly hallucinating after being high on 'mad honey' rescued in Turkey
242.article_body: A bear cub believed to be high on 'mad honey' and possibly hallucinating was rescued in Turkey after being found in a forest. The disoriented bear was captured on camera wobbling and whining in the back of a pickup truck after being rescued. Mad honey is a type of rhododendron honey that can have hallucinogenic effects.

243.title: 24-yr-old who attacked Salman Rushdie onstage in NY identified as Hadi Matar
243.article_body: A 24-year-old man named Hadi Matar has been taken into custody after he stabbed 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie onstage in New York. Matar, who is from New Jersey, stabbed Rushdie at least once in the neck and the stomach, Major Eugene Staniszewski of New York State Police said. A motive for Matar's alleged attack hasn't been determined yet.

244.title: Author Salman Rushdie on ventilator, could lose eye after being stabbed: Agent
244.article_body: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie is on ventilator after he was stabbed in the abdomen and the neck onstage in New York. "The news is not good...Salman will likely lose one eye; the nerves in his arm were severed; and his liver was stabbed and damaged," Rushdie's agent said. The interviewer onstage was also attacked and suffered facial injury.

245.title: Students understood JNU not for anti-national activities: Chancellor
245.article_body: JNU students have realised that it is not a place for activities that are anti-national or against the interest of the nation's sovereignty, said chancellor VK Saraswat. "At times, there was a clash of ideologies, that is why you used to hear that there are problems," he added. Violent clashes have broken out inside the campus in recent years.

246.title: Advocate who beat constable in Anand Vihar police station gets bail
246.article_body: An advocate who allegedly beat up a police constable has been granted bail by a Delhi court on Friday. The court said there was no need for custodial interrogation and added that the accused had belittled the institution of the bar. The Head Constable was allegedly beaten by a group of people inside Anand Vihar police station on July 31.

247.title: There was a pool of blood around Rushdie, people were saying 'He has a pulse': Eyewitness
247.article_body: Rita Landman, an endocrinologist who was in audience when author Salman Rushdie was attacked on a stage in New York, said there was a pool of blood around him. Landman, who walked on stage to offer assistance, added he appeared to be alive and wasn't receiving CPR. "People were saying, 'He has a pulse, he has a pulse'," she stated.

248.title: LinkedIn user's post on specially-abled B'luru Swiggy delivery man goes viral
248.article_body: In a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Bengaluru resident shared a picture of a specially-abled Swiggy delivery man. Rohit Kumar said he had got impatient over his delayed order but felt "stupid" when the delivery man arrived. "[He was] graciously smiling at me...[and] trying to balance himself with crutches...I [felt] stupid [for getting] impatient sitting on my comfortable bed," Rohit said.

249.title: Asia Cup game against India just like any other match: Babar Azam
249.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said that they would approach their first game of the Asia Cup 2022 against India as any other match. He said the team will play the tournament by focusing on their game and believing in their abilities. "Putting our best effort is in our hands, but results are not," said the top-order batsman.

250.title: Ridiculous: BJP on rumours about replacing Karnataka CM Bommai
250.article_body: BJP National General Secretary in charge of Karnataka Arun Singh on Friday said speculation on replacing Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai was "ridiculous", saying "these are tricks of Congress". He asserted that BJP will contest the 2023 Karnataka assembly polls under Bommai's leadership. He said Congress was trying to create confusion as there was infighting among Congress members.

251.title: UK officially declares drought in large parts of England
251.article_body: Large parts of England were officially declared drought-hit on Friday, amid prolonged heatwave conditions in the country. The affected regions include all of east England and parts of south and central England. "We are currently experiencing a second heatwave after what was the driest July on record for parts of the country," said UK Water Minister Steve Double.

252.title: Timely slap to BJP: Tejashwi on Nitish Kumar quitting NDA alliance
252.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav said JDU chief Nitish Kumar's decision to break away from the NDA alliance was "a timely slap to BJP". Yadav was speaking to the media after stepping out from meeting Congress President Sonia Gandhi in Delhi. The new RJD-JDU alliance is set to undergo a floor test to prove its majority on August 24.

253.title: First Africa-bound UN grain ship arrives in Ukraine since invasion
253.article_body: The first Africa-bound United Nations-chartered grain ship since Russia's invasion of Ukraine docked in Pivdennyi port on Friday, Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said on Friday. The ship was hired to carry Ukrainian grain to famine-stricken parts of the Horn of Africa, where 18 million people face severe hunger. The war had halted grain exports from Ukraine.

254.title: Kerala MLA KT Jaleel calls PoK 'Azad Kashmir', BJP criticises him
254.article_body: CPI(M)-backed independent Kerala MLA KT Jaleel called Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) "Azad Kashmir" in a Facebook post, after his visit to Srinagar. He also criticised the Centre's decision to abrogate Article 370 and said, "The special status was taken away without their consent". The BJP has reacted by calling Jaleel "anti-India" and asked for him to be booked for sedition.

255.title: Delhi reports 10 deaths due to COVID-19, logs 2,136 fresh cases
255.article_body: Delhi recorded 10 fatalities due to COVID-19 on Friday, the highest in six months, as per data released by the health department. According to the data, the national capital also logged 2,136 fresh cases of the infection with a positivity rate of 15.02%. On Thursday, Delhi had reported 2,726 cases, the highest single-day spike in daily caseload in six-and-a-half months.

256.title: Will lead to a revolution: Harsha Bhogle on window for women's IPL
256.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has said that a dedicated window in the sporting calendar for women's IPL will "lead to a revolution" in the women's game in India. This comes as reports claimed that the BCCI is likely to schedule a women's IPL in March 2023. BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said the event would be a "priority" for them.

257.title: NIA arrests 10th accused in Umesh Kolhe murder case
257.article_body: The NIA on Friday arrested 28-year-old Shaikh Shakeel for his alleged involvement in the murder of pharmacist Umesh Kolhe in Maharashtra's Amravati. During investigation, Shakeel's "active role" in the murder conspiracy came to light, the agency said. Shakeel is the tenth accused to be arrested in the case. Kolhe was allegedly murdered for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

258.title: ED attaches assets worth over ₹300 crore of Bengaluru's Mantri Developers
258.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached immovable assets worth over ₹300 crore as part of its ongoing money laundering probe against Bengaluru-based real estate group Mantri Developers. The private firm is alleged to have cheated several home buyers, officials said. Notably, the home buyers' money was given to the developers but had been allegedly "diverted" for non-construction activities.

259.title: Man from minority Ahmadi community stabbed to death in Pakistan
259.article_body: A 62-year-old man belonging to Pakistan's minority Ahmadi community was stabbed to death in Rabwah town on Friday allegedly for refusing to chant Islamist slogans. "The accused approached Naseer Ahmad...and asked him to raise slogans of an Islamist party," a spokesman for the minority group said. "On Ahmad's refusal, he repeatedly stabbed and killed him on spot," the spokesman added.

260.title: VVS Laxman to be India's acting head coach for Zimbabwe ODI series
260.article_body: Former cricketer VVS Laxman will be the acting head coach of the Indian team for the next week's ODI series in Zimbabwe. "Yes, Laxman will be in charge...It's not like Rahul Dravid is taking a break," BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said. He added, "[But Dravid is absent because] there is little gap between the Asia Cup and Zimbabwe series."

261.title: Kejriwal a 'lie minister', creating fear among masses: Anurag Thakur
261.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of "creating fear" among the masses regarding Centre's finances and called him a "lie minister". Kejriwal has alleged that the BJP-led Centre lacks funds to support social welfare schemes as it has waived loans and taxes worth crores of rupees of its "super-rich friends".

262.title: Pavan Varma quits Trinamool Congress months after joining it
262.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Pavan Varma quit Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Friday, months after joining the party. Varma had joined TMC after being sacked from JD(U) due to his stand on Citizenship Amendment Act. His resignation comes after JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar broke ties with BJP and joined hands with Rashtriya Janata Dal to form the Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar.

263.title: India's relationship with China is not normal: S Jaishankar
263.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that the relationship between India and China "cannot be normal as the border situation is not normal". While speaking at an event, the minister said that if China disturbed the peace in border areas, it would impact relations. He added that the Indian military has been holding its ground at the border.

264.title: EU proposal on nuclear deal acceptable if assurances provided: Iran
264.article_body: EU's proposal for revival of the 2015 nuclear deal can be acceptable if it provides Iran with "assurance on...safeguards, sanctions and guarantees," Iranian state media reported citing a senior diplomat on Friday. The EU on Monday said it had submitted its "final text" for revival of the pact as indirect talks between Iran and the US regarding the issue concluded.

265.title: Raju Srivastava's family issues statement, says 'his condition is stable'
265.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's family has issued a statement saying his condition is stable. "We are praying for his speedy recovery. The doctors are treating him and are doing their best...Please ignore any rumours/ fake news being circulated," the statement read. The comedian was admitted to Delhi's AIIMS after he suffered a heart attack on Wednesday.

266.title: Liverpool's Joel Matip injured ahead of Palace clash: Report
266.article_body: Liverpool defender Joel Matip reportedly sat out Friday's training session due to a groin problem. With the club's first-choice central defender Ibrahima Konate injured, Matip played in the opening match of the Premier League 2022-23 against Fulham. The reported injury may affect Matip's availability for the match against Crystal Palace on August 15.

267.title: Raju Srivastava moved his fingers & shoulders, your prayers are working: Suman
267.article_body: Sharing a health update about comedian Raju Srivastava who was hospitalised following a heart attack, Shekhar Suman tweeted, "Good news, Raju moved his fingers and shoulders." "Things looking slightly positive according to the doctors. Your prayers are working," he added. Earlier in the day, Shekhar tweeted, "Raju hasn't regained consciousness in...last 46 hours...pray hard for his recovery."

268.title: Videos by neighbour compared me to Babar, Aurangzeb: Salman in defamation trial
268.article_body: In the defamation case filed by actor Salman Khan against his neighbour Ketan Kakkad and others, Salman said that the videos uploaded by Kakkad, "communally provoked the viewers against" him. Kakkad compared Salman to Babar and Aurangzeb in a video and said he was "trying to shut down a Ganesh temple", the actor's counsel told the Bombay High Court.

269.title: No Indian player can play or mentor any team in overseas T20 leagues: BCCI
269.article_body: With several IPL franchises buying teams in foreign T20 leagues, the BCCI said that no Indian player can take part in any other league until he is retired from all forms of the game. "If any player wants to take part in these upcoming leagues he can only do so when he cuts off all ties with...BCCI," the BCCI stated.

270.title: Author Salman Rushdie, who was stabbed on stage, is alive: NY Governor
270.article_body: Author Salman Rushdie, who was stabbed on stage as he was about to give a lecture, is alive and has been airlifted to safety, said New York Governor Kathy Hochul. The author is getting the care he needs at a local hospital, she added. The incident took place at Chautauqua Institution in New York.

271.title: Will work harder, score more runs: Ishan on missing out from Asia Cup squad
271.article_body: After not being named in the Indian squad for the upcoming Asia Cup tournament, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said that he will "work harder and score more runs". "I feel that what selectors do is fair. They put a lot of thought while selecting players," Kishan said. Notably, the 24-year-old cricketer is India's second highest run-scorer in T20Is this year.

272.title: 9 yrs on, we have a very strong bond: Dhawan on friendship with Rohit
272.article_body: Indian batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he shares a "very strong bond and friendship" with skipper Rohit Sharma. "Nine years on...we've come to understand each other's game...we are always looking to support each other," Dhawan said. He added, "Rohit has been a fantastic opening partner and to have a milestone that I share with Rohit is a happy feeling."

273.title: Gang violence in Mexico's Ciudad Juárez leaves 11 dead
273.article_body: Mexican security officials on Friday said a gang riot inside a border prison that left two inmates dead quickly spread to the streets of Ciudad Juárez where alleged gang members killed nine more people. "They attacked the civilian, innocent population like a sort of revenge," Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said. About 20 others were injured in the violence.

274.title: Aamir faces complaint for allegedly disrespecting Indian Army in Laal Singh Chaddha
274.article_body: A complaint has been filed against Aamir Khan and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' for allegedly disrespecting the Indian Army and hurting Hindu sentiments. A Delhi-based lawyer, in his complaint, stated, "The makers have depicted that a mentally challenged person was allowed to join Army." He also alleged that a scene in the movie caused "enraged emotions among the Hindu religion followers".

275.title: World javelin champion Peters beaten up on boat, thrown into water; video surfaces
275.article_body: Grenadian javelin thrower Anderson Peters, who recently won gold in World Athletics Championships, was beaten up and thrown off a boat in his native country. A video has surfaced online showing a group of men beating him on the boat called 'Harbour Master'. Peters was later thrown into the water. He reportedly suffered minor injuries in the incident.

276.title: Free entry to Taj Mahal premises from August 13-15: ASI
276.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) announced on Friday that entry to the premises of Taj Mahal will remain free and accessible for all visitors from August 13-15. However, the main mausoleum has been exempted from this provision in order to effectively manage the visitors, ASI added. Earlier, Union Culture Ministry announced free entry to all ASI-protected monuments from August 5-15.

277.title: Fan asks why shooter Abhinav Bindra retired too early, Bindra responds
277.article_body: Reacting to a Twitter post about the 14th anniversary of shooter Abhinav Bindra's Olympic gold medal-winning moment, a fan asked why he retired too early. Bindra responded, "1) Recognised my fading skills 2) Failed in two successive [Olympic] Games 3) Was...appropriate time to give my spot to...younger athlete and talent! (did not just want to hold on to it)."

278.title: China and Nepal agree to build trans-Himalayan rail network
278.article_body: The Chinese Foreign Ministry said that China and Nepal have agreed to build the so-called Trans-Himalayan Multi-Dimensional Connectivity Network under China's Belt and Road Initiative. China would finance the feasibility study of a cross-border railway and send experts to Nepal to conduct surveys this year, it added. The network will involve the building of railways and communication networks.

279.title: Akshay is family, started tying rakhi to him almost 30 yrs ago: Rupali
279.article_body: Rupali Ganguly, in an episode of 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar', spoke about her bond with Akshay Kumar and said, "Akshay is family to us." She revealed she started tying rakhi to him almost 30 years ago. Rupali further said Akshay became very close to her because of her father, who had given film to the actor in his early days.

280.title: Red Bull F1 boss says he looks up to Alex Ferguson in dealing with criticism
280.article_body: Red Bull F1 chief Christian Horner has said that he looks up to former Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson when he has to deal with criticism. "I doubt he ever worried about what perception other managers or people thought about him," said Horner about the now-retired manager. He was responding to questions about his aggressive style and nature of management.

281.title: School bus falls off road in Himachal Pradesh; 12 students injured
281.article_body: As many as 12 students of SSRVM Senior Secondary School were injured after their bus fell 20-30 m from the road. The incident took place near Lamlehri Upperli bend in Una. All the students on the bus were rescued and taken to a regional hospital in Una. The condition of three of the injured students is serious, an official said.

282.title: Boy barred from giving Guj class 12 board exams for bribing examiner
282.article_body: A class 12 student has been debarred from giving the Gujarat board examinations for a year, as he allegedly tried to bribe an examiner, an official said on Friday. The science stream student is accused of attaching a ₹500 note to his answer sheet in this year's examinations. The boy is among 22 science stream students who faced disciplinary action.

283.title: 24 Pakistani refugees get Indian citizenship in Gujarat's Rajkot
283.article_body: At least 24 refugees, mostly Hindus, from Pakistan were granted Indian citizenship by authorities in Gujarat's Rajkot on Friday, an official said. Gujarat Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi handed over citizenship certificates to them, an official release stated. "My family has been waiting for...16 years to get Indian citizenship," a youngster pursuing career in aviation sector said.

284.title: Glad TN got 5th elephant reserve in Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai: Stalin
284.article_body: On World Elephant Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said he was glad the state got its fifth elephant reserve at Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai. "Elephants play a critical role in balancing...forest ecosystems," he tweeted. This comes after the Union Environment Ministry made an announcement accepting a proposal of the state forest department to notify the land as an elephant reserve.

285.title: Karnataka Cabinet passes aerospace and defence policy
285.article_body: The Karnataka Cabinet on Friday passed the 'Karnataka Aerospace and Defence Policy 2022-27' which aims to attract ₹45,000 crore investment. It offers incentives to manufacturing units and companies in the sector. "The aim is to make Karnataka a hub in aerospace and defence sectors. We want to strengthen the state's position...and encourage exports," Minister JC Madhuswamy said.

286.title: In touch with family: MEA after Indian-origin woman's suicide in US
286.article_body: Days after Indian-origin woman Mandeep Kaur died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, India's External Affairs Ministry on Friday informed that the Indian Consulate in New York is in touch with the family and local authorities. "Our embassy in Washington is in contact with the US authorities, who assured us of appropriate action," MEA Spokesperson said.

287.title: Terrible day for literature: Dalrymple on attack on Salman Rushdie
287.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in the US on Friday, historian William Dalrymple tweeted, "A terrible day for literature, for freedom of speech and for authors everywhere." "Poor poor Salman: I pray he's not hurt and recovers quickly," he added. Rushdie, who wrote 'The Satanic Verses', was attacked as he was about to give a lecture.

288.title: Andhra govt bans 'derogatory and abusive' slang for Nayee Brahmins
288.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has banned the use of a few words in the local slang that are derogatory to the Nayee Brahmin community. "Any person using such abusive and prohibited words...shall be liable for action under the...Indian Penal Code," the order said. The new rule was brought in based on recommendations of the Backward Classes Welfare Department.

289.title: Boris Johnson has not returned my calls: Rishi Sunak
289.article_body: Britain's prime ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said Prime Minister Boris Johnson has not returned his calls since he resigned from the UK Cabinet as Chancellor last month. Speaking to 'The Daily Telegraph', Sunak said, "I have messaged and called but, unsurprisingly, he hasn't returned my calls." Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are contesting to become Britain's next Prime Minister.

290.title: 5 Chinese state-owned companies to delist from New York Stock Exchange amid US tensions
290.article_body: Five Chinese state-owned companies would delist from the New York Stock Exchange amid economic and diplomatic tensions with the United States. They include China Life Insurance, PetroChina, China Petroleum & Chemical, Aluminum Corporation of China Limited and Sinopec Shanghai Petrochemical. The five companies were flagged by the US securities regulator as failing to meet its auditing standards.

291.title: Kareena wishes Sara Ali Khan on her b'day, shares throwback pic
291.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to wish Sara Ali Khan on her birthday. Sharing a childhood picture of Sara with Saif Ali Khan, she wrote, "Happy Birthday darling Sara. Unlimited pizza and cakes for you today." Sara is the daughter of Saif from his first wife, Amrita Singh. Sara turned 27 on Friday.

292.title: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav gets Z+ security cover, bulletproof car
292.article_body: The Bihar government on Friday granted Z+ security cover and a bulletproof car to Tejashwi Yadav, who took oath as the new Deputy Chief Minister of the state. According to an official, a circular to this effect was issued on Thursday and commandos of the Bihar Special Armed Police (BSAP) would be involved in the security of the RJD leader.

293.title: Rushdie suffered apparent stab wound to neck, his condition not known yet: NY Police
293.article_body: New York State Police have issued a statement in regard to the attack on author Salman Rushdie. "On August 12...at about 11 am, a male suspect ran up onto the stage and attacked Rushdie," the statement read. "Rushdie suffered an apparent stab wound to the neck, and was transported by helicopter to...[a]...hospital. His condition is not yet known," it added.

294.title: Police stop 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader in Bengal
294.article_body: Police stopped a 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari in West Bengal's Nandigram on Friday. They said the leader only had permission for 'padyatra', not bike journey. "A procession to campaign for hoisting the Indian National Flag is being prohibited...Does the [West Bengal] Administration feel that the state isn't a part of India?" Adhikari tweeted.

295.title: Over 2,500 houses destroyed in Sudan floods
295.article_body: Seasonal rains and floods have destroyed over 2,500 houses in east Sudan, leaving thousands homeless in what is an already impoverished region. The nationwide death toll from the rains is still undetermined. Since the monsoon season began in May, about 38,000 people have been affected by floods in Sudan, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said.

296.title: ED freezes assets worth ₹370 crore of crypto exchange Vauld's India entity
296.article_body: The ED has frozen assets worth ₹370 crore of Flipvolt Technologies, the Indian entity of crypto exchange Vauld, in a money laundering case. "Lax KYC norms, loose regulatory control of allowing transfers to foreign wallets without asking any reason, non-recording of transactions on blockchains to save costs...has ensured...Flipvolt isn't able to give any account for missing crypto assets," ED said.

297.title: I love my boys but I wanted a daughter: Shefali Shah
297.article_body: Shefali Shah, who shares two sons with her filmmaker-husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah, said she wanted to have a daughter in both of her pregnancies. "I wanted a daughter. I love my boys, but I wanted a daughter, both...times," she said. Shefali was most recently seen in 'Darlings', in which she played a mother to Badrunissa Sheikh, played by Alia Bhatt.

298.title: This year's last Supermoon seen in skies across the world, pics surface
298.article_body: This year's third and last Supermoon has been spotted in night skies across the world, with pictures of the natural phenomenon being shared online. Referred to as the Sturgeon Moon, the Supermoon reached its zenith in the early hours of Friday morning. It appeared bigger than normal with orange hues.

299.title: Russian officials trained in Iran as part of drone deal: US
299.article_body: Russian officials received training in Iran over recent weeks as part of the agreement for transfer of drones from Iran to Russia, the US State Department said on Thursday. Last month, Washington said it had information that suggested Iran was preparing to provide Russia with up to a several hundred drones, including some "weapons-capable" ones, amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

300.title: China sanctions Lithuanian deputy minister over her Taiwan visit
300.article_body: China on Friday said that it has sanctioned Lithuania's Deputy Transport and Communications Minister, Agne Vaiciukeviciute, over her visit to Taiwan. China's foreign ministry said that all engagements between Beijing and Vaiciukeviciute's ministry would also be suspended. Lithuania's Ministry of Transport and Communications said it had not received any official information regarding the matter.

301.title: Fossil of small armour-plated dinosaur discovered in Argentina
301.article_body: The remains of a small armoured dinosaur that lived about 100 million years ago were discovered in Argentina. It likely walked upright on its back legs and weighed as much as a pet cat. Named Jakapil kaniukura, the dinosaur would have been well-protected with rows of bony disk-shaped armour along its neck and back, down to its tail, researchers said.

302.title: When will we discuss loan waivers to big corporations?: Congress
302.article_body: Congress on Friday asked when there will be a discussion on loan waivers to big corporations. "When will there be a discussion on freebies given by the public sector banks of ₹5.8 lakh crore in the last five years?" Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh asked. These comments come in the wake of PM Narendra Modi's criticism of the culture of 'freebies'.

303.title: Shah Rukh Khan's reported look from 'Brahmāstra' leaked online, pics go viral
303.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's pictures, reportedly from 'Brahmāstra', were leaked online. The actor's first look as Vanarastra, inspired by Lord Hanuman, has gone viral on the internet. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "I am getting goosebumps already" while another comment read, "This leaked footage is gold." "SRK’s presence...will make #Brahmāstra an even more exciting affair!" another Twitter user wrote.

304.title: Rare microscopic creatures discovered in Scottish caves
304.article_body: Researchers have discovered rare microscopic creatures, the tiny crustaceans named ostracods, in the Smoo Cave in Sutherland and Allt nan Uamh Stream Cave in Assynt. The creatures found are around one millimetre in size and were found residing in pools inside the caves. "Styglobitic creatures live entirely below the earth's surface," a researcher said.

305.title: RCB's official YouTube channel hacked, name changed to 'MicroStrategy'
305.article_body: The official YouTube channel of Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) was hacked, with hackers changing the name of the channel to 'MicroStrategy'. The hackers also posted a video with thumbnail reading, "Event Now...Hurry Up!" The channel was later removed, with "This account has been terminated for violating YouTube's Community Guidelines" message being displayed on opening the channel.

306.title: Minister TS Singhdeo's relative found dead near Bilaspur railway track
306.article_body: Chhattisgarh minister and Congress leader TS Singhdeo's relative Bir Bhadra Pratap was found dead near a railway track in Bilaspur's Belghana, police said on Friday. Bir Bhadra, who was popularly known as Sachin Singh, died after allegedly falling from a train, ANI reported. Chhattisgarh Police said post-mortem examination has been done.

307.title: Around 250 people executed in Iran this year
307.article_body: Iran executed around 250 people since the beginning of this year, human rights organisation Amnesty International said in a recent report. The number of executions this year is twice as many as the same period last year in Iran, the report added. In 2021, Iran is estimated to have executed 314 people, the second-highest rate of executions per capita.

308.title: Suryakumar Yadav buys Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore, pic surfaces
308.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav bought a Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore ahead of Asia Cup 2022, which will begin in the UAE later this month. Earlier this year, Suryakumar had bought a Nissan 1 Ton Jonga. Suryakumar made his Team India debut in 2021 and has played 13 ODIs and 23 T20Is so far.

309.title: Jadeja has to prove his batting to replace Karthik, Pandya: Manjrekar
309.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's position in the India T20I team. "If Jadeja is going to be a batting all-rounder, then he has got to show that he is an adequate replacement to...Dinesh Karthik, who is likely to bat at number 6-7, or...Hardik Pandya," Manjrekar said.

310.title: Terrorists open fire at checkpoint in Kashmir, policeman injured
310.article_body: Terrorists opened fire at a security checkpoint in Anantnag, resulting in injuries to a Jammu and Kashmir policeman. The police have cordoned off the area and a search is underway for the attackers. The injured policeman, Ghulam Qadir, was immediately evacuated and is currently receiving treatment in a hospital, the Kashmir Police said in a tweet.

311.title: Valour of soldiers to be included in school textbooks: Education Minister
311.article_body: Tales of valour of Indian soldiers would soon be made part of the school textbooks, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, said. "To strengthen the sense of responsibility towards the nation from an early age, the education ministry in consultation with the defence ministry will work to include the valour of our soldiers into the school curriculum," he said.

312.title: Terrorism suspect blows himself up in Saudi Arabia, 4 injured
312.article_body: A terrorism suspect detonated an explosive device in Saudi Arabia's Jeddah on Wednesday as security forces attempted to arrest him, killing himself and injuring four others, state media reported on Friday. The man has been identified as Abdullah bin Zaid Abdulrahman Al-Bakry Al-Shihry. He was wanted in connection with a deadly 2015 bombing in the country.

313.title: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie attacked during lecture in US
313.article_body: India-born author of 'The Satanic Verses', Salman Rushdie, was attacked on Friday as he was about to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution in New York, AP reported. A man stormed the stage Rushdie was on and punched or stabbed him during the author's introduction, AP said. Rushdie fell to the floor and his attacker was reportedly restrained.

314.title: Party will talk to Opposition to make Mamata PM candidate: TMC MP
314.article_body: Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, TMC MP Saugata Roy said his party will talk to others in the Opposition to make West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee a joint prime ministerial candidate. "Mamata Banerjee is leading in this. She's backed by this huge state," Roy said. "Our workers definitely want Mamata as the PM candidate," Roy added.

315.title: Man tasked by Pak's Jaish terror group to kill Nupur Sharma arrested: UP Police
315.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad on Friday arrested terrorist Muhammad Nadeem from Saharanpur. According to the agency, the accused was allegedly in direct contact with Pakistan-based terrorist outfits Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) and Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan (TTP). He was tasked by JeM to kill Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from the BJP over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

316.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' gets 4.5/10 rating on IMDb with 55,000 1-star ratings
316.article_body: Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' currently has a rating of 4.5/10 on IMDb with over 55,000 one-star ratings. As of 8:25 pm on Friday, as many as 89,577 IMDb users have rated the movie, with 55,819 (62.3%) giving one star to it. As many as 21,063 users have given 10/10, while 6,102 gave 9/10 and 3,111 users gave 8/10.

317.title: Please don't boycott 'Laal...', people have worked so hard on it: Kareena
317.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan in an interview requested people not to boycott her latest film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Please don't boycott this film, because it's...like boycotting good cinema," she said, adding, "And people have worked so hard on it; we've had 250 people work on this film for two-and-a-half years." The film reportedly collected ₹12 crore on its opening day.

318.title: The Great Khali cries while posing for photographers, video leaves fans confused
318.article_body: A video has shown former WWE star Dalip Singh Rana aka The Great Khali suddenly crying while posing in front of photographers. Khali is seen walking toward the paparazzi waiting to photograph him and waving at them. He's then seen suddenly turning away from the cameras and wiping his eyes without saying anything, leaving fans confused.

319.title: Genelia is hilarious, I love watching her reels: Sonam Kapoor
319.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, during her appearance on Karan Johar's chat show 'Koffee With Karan', said that she likes the social media handle of Genelia Deshmukh. "I love watching her reels. She and Riteish (Deshmukh) are hilarious. I am constantly stalking her on social media," she said. Sonam appeared on 'Koffee With Karan' with Arjun Kapoor.

320.title: Developments from Bihar are encouraging to forge pro-people alternative: Raja
320.article_body: After meeting Bihar's Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Delhi on Friday, the General Secretary of the Communist Party of India, D Raja, has commented on the recent political change in the state. "Developments from Bihar are encouraging to forge a secular-democratic unity & pro-people alternative to RSS-BJP's divisive politics before general elections in 2024," Raja tweeted.

321.title: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik launches irrigation projects in Mayurbhanj
321.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday launched Deo and Subarnarekha irrigation projects in Mayurbhanj district and also laid the foundation stone for many developmental projects on Friday. Both the irrigation projects are expected to benefit the people of Mayurbhanj and Balasore districts, the Chief Minister's office informed. The CM added that ₹685 crore were invested for the Subarnarekha project.

322.title: 12, including 4 Nepali nationals, injured as bus hits divider in UP
322.article_body: At least 12 people, including three Nepali passengers and the bus driver, who is from Nepal, were injured after their bus rammed into the divider on Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday, officials said. Three Nepali passengers, Manju Darai, Bhanubhakt and Priti Pandey sustained critical injuries, police said. The bus, carrying 35 passengers, was travelling from Pokhara in Nepal to Delhi.

323.title: 10 Bangladeshi nationals, including 2 children, deported from Assam
323.article_body: At least 10 Bangladeshi nationals, including two children, who were caught on charges of entering the country illegally were reportedly deported to Bangladesh from Assam's Karimganj border on Thursday. "After a joint agreement between the offices concerned in India and Bangladesh, these people were sent," Assam Police said. They were handed over to representatives of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB).

324.title: US-made missile defence system not negotiable: South Korea to China
324.article_body: South Korea on Thursday said that a US-made missile defence system deployed by the country can never be subject to negotiations with China. This comment comes after China demanded that South Korea not deploy any more batteries and limit the use of existing ones. South Korea had announced the installation of Terminal High Altitude Area Defence (THAAD) system in 2016.

325.title: UP man wins 22-yr-old case against Railways over ₹20 extra fee, to get over ₹15,000
325.article_body: A UP man recently won a 22-year-old court case against Railways which he filed after being wrongly charged ₹20 extra due to a clerk's error in 1999. Tungnath Chaturvedi was charged ₹90 for two tickets whose actual fare totalled ₹70. Railways will pay him a ₹15,000 fine, plus ₹20 at a 12% interest for each year from 1999 to 2022.

326.title: As a Chadha, I wholeheartedly endorse 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Richa Chadha
326.article_body: Amid the calls to boycott Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Richa Chadha wrote on Twitter, "As a Chadha, I wholeheartedly endorse #LaalSinghChaddha." "[The film] made us laugh and cry in unison...excellent work by ALL," she added. The film, also starring Kareena Kapoor Khan and Naga Chaitanya, is a remake of the Hollywood film 'Forrest Gump'.

327.title: Had crispy aromatic duck night before my 1st WC match, got out on duck: Ross Taylor
327.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor, in his book, revealed he had a superstition of not eating duck before matches. He added that the night before his first-ever World Cup match in 2007, he had a crispy aromatic duck and he got out for a duck in that match. "Rule number one...Don't have duck the night before a game," he wrote.

328.title: Shubman Gill's selfie with ₹500 note inside phone cover goes viral, fans react
328.article_body: A mirror selfie of cricketer Shubman Gill, wherein a ₹500 note can be seen inside his phone cover, went viral. The photo was shared by Gill on Instagram after getting his hair styled from celebrity hairstylist Aalim Hakim. "500 is glowing," a user wrote. "He also keeps ₹500 note in phone cover...at least something is common between us," another wrote.

329.title: What are the 'freebies' provided to Chief Justice of India: Jayant
329.article_body: After a Supreme Court bench termed the distribution of freebies by political parties as a "serious issue", RLD President Jayant Chaudhary asked that "what are the 'freebies' provided to the Chief Justice of India?". "Recent remarks by the SC...are not in the right spirit! The bottom of the pyramid needs direct intervention whether in ration or...financial support," Chaudhary tweeted.

330.title: 12-year-old girl raped, body found near railway track in Faridabad
330.article_body: The body of a 12-year-old girl who was allegedly raped and murdered was found near a railway track in Faridabad, police said on Friday. The minor had gone out to defecate in the evening hours, police added. According to police, her body was found after her family launched a search for her when she did not return for an hour.

331.title: Vehicles submerged as water level of Pune's Mutha river rises
331.article_body: The water level of the Mutha river in Pune rose after water was released from the Khadakwasla Dam on Thursday, following which several vehicles on riverside roads were submerged. As per reports, police, along with local residents, helped remove the submerged vehicles. The IMD has issued a heavy-rainfall alert in the city for this week.

332.title: Flag march held as Hindu groups seek to conduct puja at B'luru's Idgah Maidan
332.article_body: The Karnataka Police on Friday carried out a flag march at Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan, after some Hindu groups expressed their wish to organise a puja on Ganesh Chaturthi. A row in this connection began when Hindu activists claimed that the ground is for the public and not a property of the Waqf Board.

333.title: Can't trust those who don't hoist Tricolour on I-Day: U'khand BJP chief
333.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP chief Mahendra Bhatt said people who don't hoist the Tricolour on their houses on Independence Day cannot be trusted. "It is only natural. After all, why should any Indian have problems in hoisting the Tricolour on their houses to celebrate the occasion?" he said. He later clarified that his remark was "meant only for party workers".

334.title: Mumbai Police team visits Ranveer Singh's house to issue summons over his nude pics
334.article_body: A team from Mumbai Police on Friday went to Ranveer Singh's residence to issue him summons in connection with an FIR against him for posting his nude photographs on Instagram. He was not at his residence and the police were told he would be back on August 16. The team will once again visit his residence to serve the summons.

335.title: BCCI mulling to organise 1st women's IPL in March 2023: Report
335.article_body: The BCCI is reportedly planning to hold the first edition of the women's IPL in the March 2023 window. According to a report, BCCI is keen on this window, especially after deciding to begin the women's domestic season in October instead of November. Notably, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly had earlier said that the board wants a full-fledged WIPL from 2023.

336.title: India urges Canada to ensure adequate security for its I-Day events
336.article_body: The Indian High Commission has urged the Canadian government to ensure adequate security arrangements for India's Independence Day celebrations at its missions across Canada, and for events organised by the Indo-Canadian community. There was information suggesting pro-Khalistan and pro-Pakistan Kashmiri groups were "planning to disrupt" such events, Indian officials cited by Hindustan Times said.

337.title: NIA arrests 9th accused in Kanhaiya Lal murder case
337.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested one Muslim Khan in connection with the murder of Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal, officials said. The 41-year-old accused, a resident of Rajasthan's Pratapgarh, played an "active role" in the conspiracy, the agency said. This is the ninth arrest made by the NIA in the case since taking over the investigation on June 29.

338.title: Locals claim BBMP is selling faulty national flags in Bengaluru
338.article_body: Locals from Bengaluru took to Twitter to allege that civic body BBMP is selling faulty national flags in the city. RTI activist Veeresh Bellur said the size of some flags wasn't even and the Ashoka Chakra wasn't placed correctly in some flags. A BBMP official said 1-2% of the flags it received from Kannada and Culture Department had "minor issues".

339.title: 2 Shiv Sena party workers booked for 'defaming' PM Modi
339.article_body: Two Shiv Sena party workers have been booked for allegedly sharing morphed photographs of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah with a derogatory message on social media. Both the accused reportedly belonged to the Yuva Sena. According to the police, while one of the accused shared the alleged post on social media, the other supported it.

340.title: 2 injured in attack by group in Delhi's Wazirabad
340.article_body: Two persons were injured after a group of 10 people attacked them in north Delhi's Wazirabad area, police said on Friday. Officials added that they received reports of shots being fired in the air in the area on Thursday night. The group was searching for one Deepak, after failing to find him it attacked passersby and damaged vehicles, police said.

341.title: Hatred was sown in society when BJP was in power: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi
341.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav accused BJP of causing communal disharmony in the state and said "hatred was sown in the society" under BJP's rule. "Issues like Hindu-Muslim and Mandir-Masjid were only discussed when BJP was in power," he said. "Since we've formed the government, issues like employment and those related to youth's future are being addressed," Tejashwi said.

342.title: Ex-BJP MLA's wife gets 4-yr jail term for circulating fake currency
342.article_body: The second wife of ex-BJP MLA Putkar Hembrom has been sentenced to four years in jail by Jharkhand court for circulating fake currency. A fine of ₹5,000 was also imposed on her. Earlier, a woman from Matkamhatu village claimed Malaya Hembrom had given her a ₹2,000 note, which wasn't accepted by SBI. She claimed Malaya attacked her on being confronted.

343.title: Raju Srivastava hasn't regained consciousness in the last 46 hours, tweets Shekhar Suman
343.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava, who was admitted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday following a heart attack, hasn't regained consciousness in the last 46 hours, tweeted Shekhar Suman on Friday. "Please all Indians pray hard for his recovery. We can't afford to lose this gem. I'm sure he is going to come back. God is great," Suman added.

344.title: Mumbai Indians-owned UAE franchise announce their squad
344.article_body: Mumbai Indians-owned MI Emirates today announced their squad for inaugural edition of UAE's International League T20. The squad includes veteran West Indian all-rounders Kieron Pollard and Dwayne Bravo. It also includes English batter Will Smeed, who recently became the first cricketer to slam a hundred in The Hundred. Local players from UAE will be added to squad later, MI said.

345.title: Go First B'luru-Maldives flight makes emergency landing as faulty alarm gets triggered
345.article_body: A Go First Bengaluru-Male (Maldives) flight with 92 passengers made an emergency landing at Coimbatore airport after an alarm went off, warning about engine overheating, officials said. The flight was checked and engineers found that the alarm was faulty, officials said. They said the flight was declared fit for takeoff and was scheduled to leave after 5 pm.

346.title: Hyderabad businessman cheated of ₹1 crore in crypto fraud
346.article_body: A businessman in Hyderabad was allegedly cheated of ₹1 crore by fraudsters after investing in cryptocurrency. Police said the victim was added to a WhatsApp group that had people interested in cryptocurrency and upon contacting the investment firm, he was asked to download two applications. "Lured by [initial] profits, he invested around ₹1 crore...through direct payment," police said.

347.title: It's ridiculous: 'Good...' maker on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
347.article_body: Siddharth Sen, director of Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Good Luck Jerry', has reacted to social media trends demanding a boycott of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan' and Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "It's ridiculous," he said, adding that people who're doing it have too much time. "You pull out an old tweet and say don't watch, I'm finding it very absurd," said Siddharth.

348.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' becomes Aamir Khan's lowest opener in 13 years
348.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' collected ₹10.75 crore on its opening day, as per Box Office India. This is the actor's lowest opening in the last 13 years. His 2018 film 'Thugs of Hindostan' had opened at ₹52 crore. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recorded the third biggest opening for a Hindi film in 2022 after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

349.title: BJP ruining schools & hospitals so people go to private ones: Sisodia
