349.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP for "making fun of welfare schemes" and accused them of following "Dostwaadi" model. "They [BJP] believe in ruining schools and hospitals to...extent that people are forced to go to private schools and hospitals which mostly belong to their friends," Sisodia said. "They don't believe in giving free...education to students," he said.

350.title: Punjab Cong MP's assistant attacked by over 12 people in Ludhiana
350.article_body: Punjab Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu's assistant Harjinder Singh Dhindsa was allegedly attacked by about 12 to 15 people in Ludhiana on Friday. Dhindsa was attacked with sharp-edged weapons and was rushed to a private hospital, police said. "He has multiple injuries on his body, including his head," Dr Bhagwan Singh, chairman of the hospital where Dhindsa was admitted, said.

351.title: Gurugram civic body forms 35 teams to enforce 9-day meat ban
351.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has set up 35 teams to ensure all meat shops under its limits remain closed during the Jain festival 'Paryushan Parv' from August 24 to September 1. In an earlier order, the municipality said the closure will affect 130 licensed meat shops. A penalty of ₹5,000 will be imposed on erring shops, an official said.

352.title: COVID positive burglar handcuffed to bed flees Kasturba hospital in Mumbai
352.article_body: A 22-year-old alleged burglar tested positive for COVID-19 and was admitted to Mumbai's Kasturba hospital. He was handcuffed to his bed in the COVID-19 ICU ward as police weren't allowed there to avoid infection. But, he somehow managed to escape through the hospital's toilet window. Police, however, caught him within 24 hours and brought him back to the same ward.

353.title: Global youth unemployment would decline to 7.3 cr in 2022, says UN
353.article_body: A UN report on Thursday said that the total global number of unemployed youths would decline to 7.3 crore in 2022, down by 20 lakh from the year before. However, this year's number is still 60 lakh higher than the pre-pandemic level of 2019, it added. The pandemic exacerbated the market challenges generally facing young people, it further said.

354.title: Priyanka, Nick not a good match, he looks so small in front of her: Sima
354.article_body: Sima Taparia of 'Indian Matchmaking' has said she doesn't think Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas are a good pair. "They have married, but it's not a good match. He looks so small and petite in front of her, and she looks elder," Sima said in an episode of the series. Priyanka and Nick have an age gap of 10 years.

355.title: Tejashwi Yadav to meet Sonia Gandhi in Delhi ahead of floor test
355.article_body: Bihar's new Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav will meet Congress chief Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Friday. This comes ahead of the August 24 floor test in the Bihar Assembly. After the RJD came back to power by aligning with rival Nitish Kumar's JDU, Tejashwi visited Delhi for Raksha Bandhan and to meet his father Lalu Prasad Yadav.

356.title: Over 77,000 seats vacant after 1st round of FYJC admissions in Pune
356.article_body: As many as 77,130 seats remained vacant after completion of the first regular round of admissions for first-year junior college (FYJC) or Class 11 in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions. In the first round, only 31,700 students were admitted out of 1.03 lakh students who registered online for the admission process. The second round of admissions started on Friday.

357.title: 7-yr-old attacked by 2 fighting bulls dies due to head injuries in Noida
357.article_body: A seven-year-old girl, who was attacked by stray bulls in Noida's Salarpur, died due to severe head injuries, police said. The girl was passing by D K Water Supplier in Kalika Enclave in Salarpur on Thursday afternoon when the incident took place. She was reportedly caught in a fight between the two bulls in a narrow lane in the area.

358.title: Anti-encroachment notices put up in Gurugram's Sushant Lok 1 market
358.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning on Wednesday put up notices in Gurugram's Sushant Lok 1 market directing shop owners and market association to clear illegal encroachments. A demolition drive will be carried out if the encroachments are not removed voluntarily, an official said. Corrective actions were not taken by shop owners following an anti-encroachment drive earlier, he informed.

359.title: India concerned at recent developments: Govt amid China-Taiwan tensions
359.article_body: India is "concerned" about the recent developments in the Taiwan Strait where China and Taiwan recently conducted military exercises amid high tensions, the government has said. "We urge the exercise of restraint...de-escalation of tension and efforts to maintain peace and stability," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. Tensions began over the US House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi's visit.

360.title: 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh...' reduced by exhibitors after low turnout: Report
360.article_body: Exhibitors have voluntarily reduced shows of both 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' due to low turnout, said a report. While approximately 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have been reduced, 'Raksha Bandhan' has seen a reduction of 1,000 shows across the country, it added. The films reportedly failed to earn a combined total of ₹20 crore on opening day.

361.title: Massive portion of flyover on Shimla-Kalka highway collapses, 2 cars fall off
361.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a massive portion of flyover on Shimla-Kalka highway having collapsed. The collapse occurred after heavy rains in the area. In the video, two cars can be seen damaged after falling off the flyover. Further, trucks and other vehicles on the highway can be seen slowly reversing to get to safety.

362.title: Retail inflation eases to 6.71% in July from 7.01% in June, lowest since March
362.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 6.71% in the month of July from 7.01% in June. It is the lowest since March, when CPI was recorded to be 6.95%. In May, it stood at 7.04% and in April it had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

363.title: Solar storm causes purple-green aurora to appear in Canada, pics surface
363.article_body: Unusual streaks of purple-green lights were seen in Canadian skies recently after a solar storm hit the Earth. Pictures of the aurora or northern lights were shared by astronomy author and photographer Alan Dyer, who said they were visible for about 40 minutes. The lights were seen due to a rare phenomenon called Strong Thermal Emission Velocity Enhancement or STEVE.

364.title: 'Jungle raj' has returned to Bihar: BJP on RJD-JD(U) alliance
364.article_body: After the RJD-JD(U) government assumed power in Bihar, BJP on Friday cited several crimes since the alliance formed and alleged that 'jungle raj' has returned to Bihar. "Disorder is spreading in the state at a fast pace," BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said. He claimed that BJP's presence in the state government earlier worked as a restraining influence on crime.

365.title: Hyd police buildings illuminated with Tricolour lights; pics emerge
365.article_body: All police buildings in Hyderabad have been illuminated with Tricolour lights ahead of the 75th Independence Day, Commissioner of Police CV Anand said. Hyderabad City Police shared pictures of the Commissioner's office and Telangana State Police Integrated Command and Control Center decorated with Tricolour lights. A picture of the illuminated Jubilee Hills Police Station was shared by its SHO.

366.title: Kerala Guv's interventions in govt matters weaken democratic process: CPI(M)
366.article_body: The CPI(M) Kerala Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan has said that state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan's interventions in state government matters would weaken the democratic process. "The governor (Khan) is meddling in [govt] matters in an undemocratic manner. The government and governor should work together as two constitutional bodies but the act of the governor does not reflect it," Kodiyeri said.

367.title: Pit bull seriously injures domestic help in Gurugram, FIR filed
367.article_body: A domestic help working in Gurugram was mauled by a pit bull leaving her with serious injuries on her head and face, police said. An FIR has been filed after the victim's family claimed the pit bull was let loose from its leash during its morning walk. The dog allegedly knocked the 30-year-old woman down and bit her all over.

368.title: 1st Agnipath recruitment rally for Pune zone to be held on Aug 13
368.article_body: The first Agnipath Army recruitment rally for the Pune Recruiting Zone will begin on Saturday in Aurangabad. In total, eight recruitment rallies will be held for the Pune Recruiting Zone, including one rally for Agniveer Women Military Police. "The response for the Agnipath scheme has been enthusiastic and the youth have registered adequately," the Army said in a statement.

369.title: Sri Lanka's ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa arrives in Thailand
369.article_body: Sri Lanka's former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Thursday arrived in Thailand, where he is expected to stay temporarily. Rajapaksa had arrived at Bangkok's Don Mueang International Airport on a chartered flight from Singapore. Notably, Rajapaksa, who holds a diplomatic passport, has made no public appearances or comments since fleeing Sri Lanka last month amid mass protests.

370.title: National Award-winning singer Shivamogga Subbanna dies of heart attack at 83
370.article_body: National Award-winning singer Shivamogga Subbanna passed away on Thursday night at a hospital in Bengaluru following a heart attack. He was 83. Shivamogga won a National Award for the song, 'Kaadu Kudure Odi Banditta' from the film 'Kaadu Kudure'. He was the first Kannadiga to win a National Award for playback singing.

371.title: Trump calls for 'immediate' release of FBI warrant used to search his home
371.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called for the "immediate" release of the warrant the FBI used to search his Florida home this week. This came hours after US Justice Department asked a court to unseal the warrant. The search was part of an investigation into whether Trump illegally removed records from White House as he left office in January 2021.

372.title: Man drowns in Mumbai's Mahim creek, body recovered; another feared dead
372.article_body:
A 28-year-old man drowned in Mumbai's Mahim creek and his body was recovered on Friday morning, while another person accompanying him was feared dead, officials said. The fire brigade was alerted after two men had gone missing from Mahim causeway on Thursday night.
"The body of Javed Alam Shaikh...was found floating in the creek near...Reclamation flyover bridge," the official said.

373.title: Rupee closes 4 paise lower at 79.66 against US dollar
373.article_body: The rupee fell 4 paise to close at 79.66 (provisional) against the US dollar on Friday amid rising crude oil prices and a strong dollar. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 79.67 and saw an intra-day high of 79.63 and a low of 79.72 against the dollar. The dollar index rose 0.26% to 105.36.

374.title: Sussanne, Bobby attend Arjun Kanungo-Carla's wedding reception, pics surface
374.article_body: The wedding reception of newly-married couple, singer Arjun Kanungo and South African model Carla Dennis on Thursday was attended by several celebrities from the film industry. The guests included Sussanne Khan, Arslan Goni, Bobby Deol, Tanya Deol, Kubbra Sait and many others. Arjun and Carla got married on August 10 in Mumbai.

375.title: Alliance with Shiv Sena is not permanent: Congress' Nana Patole
375.article_body: Commenting on ties with Shiv Sena, Congress leader Nana Patole said, "We had an alliance with them in a different situation. This is not our natural or permanent alliance." He also commented on the Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis-led new government and alleged that it was formed using central agencies and funds.

376.title: Mob attacks 2 in Delhi after they fail to find man they were looking for
376.article_body: A video showing a group of around 10 people attacking two persons after they failed to find a man they were looking for in Delhi's Wazirabad on Thursday has surfaced online. According to the police, they were searching for a man named Deepak. When they failed to find him, they attacked two passers-by, Jatin (17) and Ajay (42), injuring them.

377.title: Man arrested for dowry death after wife dies by suicide in Gurugram
377.article_body: A man has been arrested on dowry death charge after his 19-year-old wife allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram's Chandu village on Tuesday, police informed on Friday. According to police, a case of murder was initially registered against the accused following a complaint by deceased's family. However, probe later revealed that the woman died by suicide, an officer told media.

378.title: Man takes hostages at bank in bid to get his trapped money in crisis-hit Lebanon
378.article_body: A man entered a bank in crisis-hit Lebanon's Beirut and held at least 10 people hostage demanding access to his own trapped money, according to The Washington Post. A video showing police trying to calm the man down surfaced on social media. The man, who had about $200,000 stuck in the bank, surrendered after a seven-hour-long standoff.

379.title: Karnataka HC abolishes Anti Corruption Bureau, cases transferred to Lokayukta
379.article_body: The Karnataka HC abolished the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) formed by the then Congress state government in 2016 and transferred all the pending cases to the Lokayukta Police division. "If really the government intends to curb corruption, favouritism and official indiscipline in administration machinery, the ACB should have been allowed to work under the control of Lokayukta," the court said.

380.title: 3 die after inhaling poisonous gas inside well in MP's Sagar
380.article_body: Three people died after inhaling a poisonous gas on entering a well in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Thursday evening, police said. The victims reportedly entered the 60-feet-deep well to remove a motor, but inhaled some poisonous gas emanating from it, following which they fell unconscious and drowned. They were aged between 25 and 65 years, an official said.

381.title: Akshay's fans dance in theatre during 'Raksha Bandhan' show, video surfaces
381.article_body: A video showing fans of Akshay Kumar dancing in a theatre during the screening of 'Raksha Bandhan' has surfaced online. In the video, people could be seen dancing in front of the screen while a song from the film played in the background. The Aanand L Rai directorial collected ₹8.20 crore on Thursday, according to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

382.title: BJP didn't follow 'coalition dharma': JD(U) leader Lalan Singh
382.article_body: JD(U) leader Lalan Singh accused BJP of violating "coalition dharma" by trying to sabotage his party. He said that CM Nitish Kumar was under pressure from his own party members to pull out of the alliance. "The present BJP leadership should tell how many NDA allies are still left in the alliance as compared to 2014," Singh further said.

383.title: Somalia’s worst drought in 40 years displaces 1 million people
383.article_body: A "devastating drought" in Somalia has internally displaced one million people since the dry conditions struck in January, the UN refugee agency, UNHCR, said. "Somalia is going through a two-year historic dry spell, the likes of which haven't been seen in over 40 years," UNHCR said, adding, "An expected fifth failed rainy season is set to displace many more families."

384.title: 'Chor, chor' slogans raised as CBI produces Anubrata Mondal in court
384.article_body: Several people shouted slogans of 'chor, chor' while the Central Bureau of Investigation produced TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in a special court on Thursday in connection with cattle smuggling case, reports said. Reports added that people also showed shoes to the TMC leader. Meanwhile, Mondal was on Thursday sent to the CBI custody till August 20 by the Asansol court.

385.title: Rly police recover body packed in gunny bag from train in Bihar
385.article_body: Railway police have recovered a burnt body that was packed inside a gunny bag, which they found lying beside a toilet, from a passenger train in Bihar's Katihar on Thursday. "The man...was first killed and then his face was burnt with acid to hide his identity," an official said. The body was found after passengers complained about a foul smell.

386.title: B'luru Metro fare from Lalbagh station to cost ₹30 from August 13 to 15
386.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced a paper ticket system which will cost ₹30 to all stations from Lalbagh metro station. The tickets will be issued from August 13-15 and will be valid for a single trip, BMRCL said. The move will encourage people visiting  Independence Day Flower Show at Lalbagh Botanical Garden to use public transport.

387.title: Fire tornado caught on camera amid massive blaze in US, video released
387.article_body: Aerial footage of a fire tornado or a 'firenado' that formed amid a massive wildfire in US' California has been released online. The 'firenado' was spotted amid a brush fire that erupted on Wednesday in Gorman and spread to around 150 acres. Around 200 firefighters were called to fight the massive blaze.

388.title: I'm glad she said what she thought: Vijay on Ananya criticising 'Arjun Reddy'
388.article_body: On being asked about Ananya Panday's criticism of 'Arjun Reddy', actor Vijay Deverakonda said he is glad that she said what she thought. "I might not agree or disagree or I might even see both sides of the coin but it's okay," he added. Ananya had said that she won't accept the behaviours portrayed in the film in real life.

389.title: Manushi Chhillar was the first choice for 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Report
389.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar was the first choice for the role of Rupa in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', reported Bollywood Hungama. As per the report, the actress turned it down due to her contract with Yash Raj Films and made her debut in 'Samrat Prithviraj' opposite Akshay Kumar. The role of Rupa is portrayed by Kareena Kapoor.

390.title: 'Tiranga shikara rally' organised at Dal Lake in Srinagar
390.article_body: The Youth Services and Sports Department of Jammu and Kashmir organised a 'Tiranga shikara rally' at Dal Lake in Srinagar ahead of Independence Day. The rally was flagged off by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The campaign aims to encourage every citizen to bring home the National Flag and hoist it with pride.

391.title: Over 2 lakh PACS needed to meet agri-finance target: Amit Shah
391.article_body: Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah said that more than 2 lakh new primary agriculture credit societies (PACS) are needed across the country to meet the target of providing agri-finance worth ₹10 lakh crore through cooperatives. At a national conference on rural cooperative banks on Friday, he said that there are over 95,000 PACS, however, only about 63,000 are functional.

392.title: Allu Arjun's slipper step in 'Srivalli' was actually a mistake: Big B
392.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that actor Allu Arjun's step with his slipper in the song 'Srivalli' was actually a mistake. The actor said that Sukumar, who directed the film 'Pushpa: The Rise', told him while he was shooting in Hyderabad that Allu Arjun missed his slipper and it became a step. The film collected over ₹360 crore worldwide.

393.title: Can find replacement for Kohli, Rohit but not Hardik: Aakash on T20Is
393.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said Team India "can find a replacement" for Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah in their T20I lineup for tournaments like Asia Cup and T20 World Cup 2022. "But if Hardik Pandya's not there, you cannot make that XI," added Aakash. "Hardik's the only player in the squad who is providing that balance," he stated.

394.title: Mumbai Police wrongly list Haryana man's number as senior inspector
394.article_body: Mumbai Police allegedly uploaded a Haryana man's mobile number on their website mistakenly as that of the senior police inspector of the Agripada PS. The 37-year-old Sanjay Dagar reportedly received 50-70 calls daily which included complaints about molestation or tip-offs from police sources. However, the Mumbai Police have said that they will check the contact details on their website soon.

395.title: Perseid meteor shower expected to peak tonight, NASA reveals when and where to spot it
395.article_body: The Perseid meteor shower is expected to peak late Friday night into early Saturday morning. "If you do decide to look for these meteors, the best time should be after midnight...You'll need to be far from...city...in a place with no clouds...and have...clear view of...large expanse of sky. You'll need to look northward away from the glow of...Moon," said NASA.

396.title: BMC to set up 9 mini waste-to-energy plants in Mumbai
396.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is setting up nine mini waste-to-energy or biomethanisation plants across Mumbai with the capacity to process two metric tonnes (MT) of organic waste per day. Currently, three mini waste-to-energy plants are operational. "Wards have been directed to find suitable plots in their jurisdiction to set up...nine biomethanisation plants," an official said.

397.title: Ex-German Chancellor sues Parliament over stripped privileges: Report
397.article_body: Former German Chancellor Gerhard Schröder has sued the German Parliament, Bundestag, in a bid to restore special privileges he was stripped of in May, German news agency DPA reported on Friday. The Parliament had taken away some of Schröder's special rights and privileges for refusing to cut ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

398.title: Don't be so shameless: Tejashwi Yadav to Giriraj over his tweet
398.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav criticised Union Minister Giriraj Singh over his tweet in which Singh taunted Yadav for being unable to fulfil his promise of providing one million jobs. Yadav said, "Sir, don't be so shameless...This is the plight of the BJP. Only because of these idiotic antics, edited videos...,these poor people have no face in Bihar."

399.title: SC directs states to file affidavits on Haj Committees within 2 weeks
399.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday directed the state governments to file affidavits on Haj Committees within two weeks. SC has asked the states to inform it on whether Haj Committees have been constituted and to specify the names of committee members. This comes after a petition claimed that many states have not filed compliance reports under the Haj Committee Act, 2002.

400.title: Cyberabad Police solve double murder of migrant workers, 1 held
400.article_body: A migrant worker from Jharkhand, Bhuvaneswar Singh, was arrested by Cyberabad Police for allegedly murdering two migrant workers from Jharkhand. Police said Singh was arrested from his relatives' house in Jharkhand, where he was hiding. The case was initially suspected to be an accidental gas leak, but after 17 days of probe, the police arrested Singh, who confessed during questioning.
